                                                                                                                                                                                 <li id="questionBox1" class=" questLiClass">
                                    <div class="ques-no d-flex align-items-center p-3">
                                        <h6><strong>(1/51)</strong>  JEE Advanced 2023 Paper - 1</h6>
                                        <span>4 / -2</span>
                                    </div>
                                    <hr class="w-100 hr-gray mt-0">
                                    
                                    <div class="make-review bg-green mb-3 hideThis" id="questCorrectMarker473775">Q.1 Correct</div>

                                        <div class="px-3 mb-0 qsn-here"><style>.fm-math,fmath{font-family:STIXGeneral,'DejaVu Serif','DejaVu Sans',Times,OpenSymbol,'Standard Symbols L',serif;line-height:1.2}.fm-math mtext,fmath mtext{line-height:normal}.fm-mo,.ma-sans-serif,fmath mi[mathvariant*=sans-serif],fmath mn[mathvariant*=sans-serif],fmath mo,fmath .33ex}.fm-prefix-tight{padding:0 .11ex 0 0}.fm-postfix-tight{padding:0 0 0 .11ex}.fm-quantifier{padding:0 .11ex 0 .22ex}.ma-non-marking{display:none}.fm-vert,fmath menclose,menclose.fm-menclose{display:inline-block}.fm-large-op{font-size:1.3em}.fm-inline .fm-large-op{font-size:1em}fmath mrow{white-space:nowrap}.fm-vert{vertical-align:middle}fmath table,fmath .fm-script{font-size:1em}td.fm-underover-base{line-height:1!important}td.fm-mtd{padding:.5ex .4em!important;vertical-align:baseline!important}fmath mphantom{visibility:hidden}fmath menclose[notation=top],menclose.fm-menclose[notation=top]{border-top:solid thin}fmath menclose[notation=right],menclose.fm-menclose[notation=right]{border-right:solid thin}fmath menclose[notation=bottom],menclose.fm-menclose[notation=bottom]{border-bottom:solid thin}fmath menclose[notation=left],menclose.fm-menclose[notation=left]{border-left:solid thin}fmath menclose[notation=box],menclose.fm-menclose[notation=box]{border:thin solid}fmath none{display:none}</style><div class="questionText col-12 hscrollenable h5 p-3 mt-3" id="mquestion">
<span class="h5">A slide with a frictionless curved surface, which becomes horizontal at its lower end, is fixed on the terrace of a building of height <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">h</mi></mrow></fmath> from the ground, as shown in the figure. A spherical ball of mass <fmath class="fm-inline"><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">m</mi></fmath> is released on the slide from rest at a height <fmath class="fm-inline"><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">h</mi></fmath> from the top of the terrace. The ball leaves the slide with a velocity <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><msub><span mtagname="mover" style="vertical-align: 0.225em;"><span class="fm-vert"><table><tbody><tr><td><mo style="display: block; margin-top: -0.25em; margin-bottom: -0.25em;">→</mo></td></tr><tr><td class="fm-underover-base"><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic" style="display: block; margin-top: -0.25em;">u</mi></td></tr></tbody></table></span></span><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: -0.5em;"><mn>0</mn></span></msub><mo class="fm-infix-loose">=</mo><mrow><msub><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">u</mi><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: -0.5em;"><mn>0</mn></span></msub><span mtagname="mover" style="vertical-align: 0.225em;"><span class="fm-vert"><table><tbody><tr><td><mo style="display: block; margin-top: 0em; margin-bottom: -0.5em;">^</mo></td></tr><tr><td class="fm-underover-base"><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic" style="display: block; margin-top: -0.25em;">x</mi></td></tr></tbody></table></span></span></mrow></mrow></fmath> and falls on the ground at a distance <fmath class="fm-inline"><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic" style="padding-right: 0.44ex;">d</mi></fmath> from the building making an angle <fmath class="fm-inline"><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">θ</mi></fmath> with the horizontal. It bounces off with a velocity <fmath class="fm-inline"><span mtagname="mover" style="vertical-align: 0.225em;"><span class="fm-vert"><table><tbody><tr><td><mo style="display: block; margin-top: -0.25em; margin-bottom: -0.25em;">→</mo></td></tr><tr><td class="fm-underover-base"><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic" style="display: block; margin-top: -0.25em;">v</mi></td></tr></tbody></table></span></span></fmath> and reaches a maximum height <fmath class="fm-inline"><msub><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">h</mi><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: -0.5em;"><mn>1</mn></span></msub></fmath>. The acceleration due to gravity is <fmath class="fm-inline"><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">g</mi></fmath> and the coefficient of restitution of the ground is <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo class="fm-infix-loose">∕</mo><mrow mtagname="msqrt"><mo class="fm-radic">√</mo><span style="vertical-align: 0.086em;"><span class="fm-vert fm-radicand" style="border-top-width: 0.072em;"><mn>3</mn></span></span></mrow></mrow></fmath>. Which of the following statement(s) is(are) correct?<br></span><img src="https://www.topcoaching.in/ckeditor/plugins/imageuploader/uploads/24_03_14_65f2a210a084b.png" data-filename="1.png" style="width: 100%;"><span class="h5"><br><div class="hscrollenable"><span class="sprite JEE_Adv_2023_P1_1"></span></div></span>
</div></div>
                                    
                                                                            <div class="px-3 mb-0 qsn-here" style="color:#a9a9a9;">*This question may have multiple correct answers</div>

fm-radicand" style="border-top-width: 0.072em;"><mn>3</mn></span></span></mrow></mrow></mrow></fmath></span></h6>
                                                                                                                    </label>
                                                    </div>
                                                </div>
                                            
                                                                                    
                                                                            
                                    </form>

                                                                            
                                        <div class="position-relative">

                                                <p class="text-muted fs-6 mb-3 mb-md-4 lh-base px-2 px-md-0 fw-bold">

                                                <div class="h5 text-green mb-3">Solutions</div>

<div class="hscrollenable"><span class="sprite JEE_Adv_2023_P1_1_sol"></span></div><fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><msub><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">u</mi><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: -0.5em;"><mn>0</mn></span></msub><mo class="fm-infix-loose">=</mo><mrow mtagname="msqrt"><mo class="fm-radic">√</mo><span style="vertical-align: 0.086em;"><span class="fm-vert fm-radicand" style="border-top-width: 0.072em;"><mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">g</mi></mrow><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">h</mi></mrow></span></span></mrow></mrow></fmath> <br> <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><msub><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">v</mi><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: -0.5em;"><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">z</mi></span></msub><mo class="fm-infix-loose">=</mo><mrow mtagname="msqrt"><mo class="fm-radic">√</mo><span style="vertical-align: 0.086em;"><span class="fm-vert fm-radicand" style="border-top-width: 0.072em;"><mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">g</mi></mrow><mrow><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">(</mo><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">h</mi></mrow><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">)</mo></mrow></mrow></span></span></mrow></mrow></fmath><br><fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><mrow><mrow class="ma-repel-adj"><mi class="ma-repel-adj" mathvariant="normal">tan</mi><mspace style="margin-right: 0.17em; padding-right: 0.001em; visibility: hidden;" width=".28em">&zwnj;</mspace><span mtagname="mfrac" style="vertical-align: 0.252em;"><span class="fm-vert fm-frac"><table><tbody><tr><td class="fm-num-frac fm-inline"><msubsup><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">v</mi><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: -0.5em;"><mn>1</mn></span><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: 0.7em;"><mn>2</mn></span></msubsup></td></tr><tr><td class="fm-den-frac fm-inline"><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">g</mi></mrow></td></tr></tbody></table></span></span></mrow></mrow><mo class="fm-infix-loose">=</mo><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">h</mi></mrow></fmath><br>Finally, <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><mrow><mrow><msub><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">u</mi><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: -0.5em;"><mn>0</mn></span></msub><mo class="fm-infix-loose">=</mo><mrow mtagname="msqrt"><mo class="fm-radic">√</mo><span style="vertical-align: 0.086em;"><span class="fm-vert fm-radicand" style="border-top-width: 0.072em;"><mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">g</mi></mrow><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">h</mi></mrow></span></span></mrow></mrow><mo class="fm-separator">,</mo><mrow><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">θ</mi><mo class="fm-infix-loose">=</mo><msup><mn>60</mn><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: 0.7em;"><mo>∘</mo></span></msup></mrow></mrow><mo class="fm-separator">,</mo><mrow><mrow><mspace style="margin-right: 0.28em; padding-right: 0.001em; visibility: hidden;" width=".28em">&zwnj;</mspace><span mtagname="mfrac" style="vertical-align: 0em;"><span class="fm-vert fm-frac"><table><tbody><tr><td class="fm-num-frac fm-inline"><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic" style="padding-right: 0.44ex;">d</mi></td></tr><tr><td class="fm-den-frac fm-inline"><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">h</mi></td></tr></tbody></table></span></span></mrow><mo class="fm-infix-loose">=</mo><mrow><mn>2</mn><mrow mtagname="msqrt"><mo class="fm-radic">√</mo><span style="vertical-align: 0.086em;"><span class="fm-vert fm-radicand" style="border-top-width: 0.072em;"><mn>3</mn></span></span></mrow></mrow></mrow></mrow></fmath>
</div>

</div></div>
                                                                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                                                    </li>
                                                                                            
                                <li id="questionBox2" class="hideThis questLiClass">
                                    <div class="ques-no d-flex align-items-center p-3">
                                        <h6><strong>(2/51)</strong>  JEE Advanced 2023 Paper - 1</h6>
                                        <span>4 / -2</span>
                                    </div>
                                    <hr class="w-100 hr-gray mt-0">
                                    
                                    <div class="make-review bg-green mb-3 hideThis" id="questCorrectMarker473776">Q.2 Correct</div>
                                    <div class="make-review bg-red mb-3 hideThis" id="questInCorrectMarker473776">Q.2 In-Correct</div>
                                    <div class="make-review bg-yellow mb-3" id="questUnAttemptedMarker473776">Q.2 Un-Attempted</div>
                                    
                                                                            <div class="px-3 mb-0 qsn-here"></div>
                                        <div class="px-3 mb-0 qsn-here"><style>.fm-math,fmath{font-family:STIXGeneral,'DejaVu Serif','DejaVu Sans',Times,OpenSymbol,'Standard Symbols L',serif;line-height:1.2}.fm-math mtext,fmath mtext{line-height:normal}.fm-mo,.ma-sans-serif,fmath mi[mathvariant*=sans-serif],fmath mn[mathvariant*=sans-serif],fmath mo,fmath ms[mathvariant*=sans-serif],fmath mtext[mathvariant*=sans-serif]{font-family:STIXGeneral,'DejaVu Sans','DejaVu Serif','Arial Unicode MS','Lucida Grande',Times,OpenSymbol,'Standard Symbols L',sans-serif}.fm-mo-Luc{font-family:STIXGeneral,'DejaVu Sans','DejaVu Serif','Lucida Grande','Arial Unicode MS',Times,OpenSymbol,'Standard Symbols L',sans-serif}.questionsfont{font-weight:200;font-family:Arial, sans-serif, STIXGeneral,'DejaVu Sans','DejaVu Serif','Lucida Grande','Arial Unicode MS',Times,OpenSymbol,'Standard Symbols L',sans-serif!important}</style><style>.fm-separator{padding:0 .56ex 0 0}.fm-infix-loose{padding:0 .56ex}.fm-infix{padding:0 .44ex}.fm-prefix{padding:0 .33ex 0 0}.fm-postfix{padding:0 0 0 .33ex}.fm-prefix-tight{padding:0 .11ex 0 0}.fm-postfix-tight{padding:0 0 0 .11ex}.fm-quantifier{padding:0 .11ex 0 .22ex}.ma-non-marking{display:none}.fm-vert,fmath menclose,menclose.fm-menclose{display:inline-block}.fm-large-op{font-size:1.3em}.fm-inline .fm-large-op{font-size:1em}fmath mrow{white-space:nowrap}.fm-vert{vertical-align:middle}fmath table,fmath tbody,fmath td,fmath tr{border:0!important;padding:0!important;margin:0!important;outline:0!important}fmath table{border-collapse:collapse!important;text-align:center!important;table-layout:auto!important;float:none!important}.fm-frac{padding:0 1px!important}td.fm-den-frac{border-top:solid thin!important}.fm-root{font-size:.6em}.fm-radicand{padding:0 1px 0 0;border-top:solid;margin-top:.1em}.fm-script{font-size:.71em}.fm-script .fm-script .fm-script{font-size:1em}td.fm-underover-base{line-height:1!important}td.fm-mtd{padding:.5ex .4em!important;vertical-align:baseline!important}fmath mphantom{visibility:hidden}fmath menclose[notation=top],menclose.fm-menclose[notation=top]{border-top:solid thin}fmath menclose[notation=right],menclose.fm-menclose[notation=right]{border-right:solid thin}fmath menclose[notation=bottom],menclose.fm-menclose[notation=bottom]{border-bottom:solid thin}fmath menclose[notation=left],menclose.fm-menclose[notation=left]{border-left:solid thin}fmath menclose[notation=box],menclose.fm-menclose[notation=box]{border:thin solid}fmath none{display:none}</style><div class="questionText col-12 hscrollenable h5 p-3 mt-3" id="mquestion">
<span class="h5">A plane polarized blue light ray is incident on a prism such that there is no reflection from the surface of the prism. The angle of deviation of the emergent ray is <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">δ</mi><mo class="fm-infix-loose">=</mo><msup><mn>60</mn><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: 0.7em;"><mo>∘</mo></span></msup></mrow></fmath> (see Figure-1). The angle of minimum deviation for red light from the same prism is <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><msub><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">δ</mi><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: -0.5em;"><mi class="ma-repel-adj" mathvariant="normal">min</mi></span></msub><mo class="fm-infix-loose">=</mo><msup><mn>30</mn><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: 0.7em;"><mo>∘</mo></span></msup></mrow></fmath> (see Figure-2). The refractive index of the prism material for blue light is <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow mtagname="msqrt"><mo class="fm-radic">√</mo><span style="vertical-align: 0.086em;"><span class="fm-vert fm-radicand" style="border-top-width: 0.072em;"><mn>3</mn></span></span></mrow></fmath>. Which of the following statement(s) is(are) correct?<br></span><img src="https://www.topcoaching.in/ckeditor/plugins/imageuploader/uploads/24_03_14_65f2a263432b3.png" data-filename="1.png" style="width: 100%;"><span class="h5"><br><div class="hscrollenable"><span class="sprite JEE_Adv_2023_P1_2"></span></div></span>
</div></div>
                                    
                                                                            <div class="px-3 mb-0 qsn-here" style="color:#a9a9a9;">*This question may have multiple correct answers</div>

                                                            <span class="optionIndex">A</span>

<div class="text-primary border-bottom p-2 mb-2 d-flex justify-content-between align-items-center">
<strong>Solution:</strong>
</div>
<div style="position: relative;z-index:1">   
                                    For no reflection<br><img src="https://www.topcoaching.in/ckeditor/plugins/imageuploader/uploads/24_03_14_65f2a26345939.png" data-filename="2.png" style="width: 152px;"><br><div class="hscrollenable"><span class="sprite JEE_Adv_2023_P1_2_sol"></span></div><fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><mrow><mrow class="ma-repel-adj"><mi class="ma-repel-adj" mathvariant="normal">tan</mi><mspace style="margin-right: 0.17em; padding-right: 0.001em; visibility: hidden;" width=".17em">&zwnj;</mspace><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">i</mi></mrow><mspace style="margin-right: 0.28em; padding-right: 0.001em; visibility: hidden;" width=".28em">&zwnj;</mspace></mrow><mo class="fm-infix-loose">=</mo><mrow mtagname="msqrt"><mo class="fm-radic">√</mo><span style="vertical-align: 0.086em;"><span class="fm-vert fm-radicand" style="border-top-width: 0.072em;"><mn>3</mn></span></span></mrow></mrow></fmath><br><fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><mrow><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">i</mi><mspace style="margin-right: 0.28em; padding-right: 0.001em; visibility: hidden;" width=".28em">&zwnj;</mspace></mrow><mo class="fm-infix-loose">=</mo><mn>60</mn></mrow></fmath><br><fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><mrow><mrow><mrow><mspace style="margin-right: 0.28em; padding-right: 0.001em; visibility: hidden;" width=".28em">&zwnj;</mspace><span mtagname="mfrac" style="vertical-align: -0.126em;"><span class="fm-vert fm-frac"><table><tbody><tr><td class="fm-num-frac fm-inline"><mrow><mrow><mrow><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">s</mi><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">i</mi></mrow><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">n</mi></mrow><mspace style="margin-right: 0.28em; padding-right: 0.001em; visibility: hidden;" width=".28em">&zwnj;</mspace><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">i</mi></mrow></td></tr><tr><td class="fm-den-frac fm-inline"><mrow><mrow><mrow><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">s</mi><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">i</mi></mrow><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">n</mi></mrow><mspace style="margin-right: 0.28em; padding-right: 0.001em; visibility: hidden;" width=".28em">&zwnj;</mspace><msub><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">r</mi><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: -0.5em;"><mn>1</mn></span></msub></mrow></td></tr></tbody></table></span></span></mrow><mspace style="margin-right: 0.28em; padding-right: 0.001em; visibility: hidden;" width=".28em">&zwnj;</mspace></mrow><mo class="fm-infix-loose">=</mo><mrow mtagname="msqrt"><mo class="fm-radic">√</mo><span style="vertical-align: 0.086em;"><span class="fm-vert fm-radicand" style="border-top-width: 0.072em;"><mn>3</mn></span></span></mrow></mrow><mo class="fm-separator">,</mo><mrow><msub><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">r</mi><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: -0.5em;"><mn>1</mn></span></msub><mo class="fm-infix-loose">=</mo><msup><mn>30</mn><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: 0.7em;"><mo>∘</mo></span></msup></mrow></mrow></fmath><br><fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><mrow><mrow><mspace style="margin-right: 0.28em; padding-right: 0.001em; visibility: hidden;" width=".28em">&zwnj;</mspace><span mtagname="mfrac" style="vertical-align: -0.126em;"><span class="fm-vert fm-frac"><table><tbody><tr><td class="fm-num-frac fm-inline"><mrow><mrow><mrow><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">s</mi><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">i</mi></mrow><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">n</mi></mrow><mspace style="margin-right: 0.28em; padding-right: 0.001em; visibility: hidden;" width=".28em">&zwnj;</mspace><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">i</mi></mrow></td></tr><tr><td class="fm-den-frac fm-inline"><mrow><mrow><mrow><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">s</mi><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">i</mi></mrow><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">n</mi></mrow><mspace style="margin-right: 0.28em; </div>

mathvariant="normal" style="padding-right: 0px;"> </mi><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">s</mi></mrow></mrow></mrow></mrow></fmath>, the current in the capacitor is <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><mn>0.6</mn><mi class="fm-mi-length-1 ma-upright" mathvariant="normal" style="padding-right: 0px;">A</mi></mrow></fmath>.</span></h6>
                                                                                                                    </label>
                                                    </div>
                                                </div>

                                                            <span class="optionIndex">D</span>

                                    <div class="ques-no d-flex align-items-center p-3">
                                        <h6><strong>(4/51)</strong>  JEE Advanced 2023 Paper - 1</h6>
                                        <span>3 / -1</span>

L',sans-serif}.fm-mo-Luc{font-family:STIXGeneral,'DejaVu Sans','DejaVu Serif','Lucida Grande','Arial Unicode MS',Times,OpenSymbol,'Standard Symbols L',sans-serif!important}</style><style>.fm-separator{padding:0 .56ex 0 0}.fm-infix-loose{padding:0 .56ex}.fm-infix{padding:0 .44ex}.fm-prefix{padding:0 .33ex 0 0}.fm-postfix{padding:0 0 0 .33ex}.fm-prefix-tight{padding:0 .11ex 0 0}.fm-postfix-tight{padding:0 0 0 .11ex}.fm-quantifier{padding:0 .11ex 0 .22ex}.ma-non-marking{display:none}.fm-vert,fmath menclose,menclose.fm-menclose{display:inline-block}.fm-large-op{font-size:1.3em}.fm-inline .fm-large-op{font-size:1em}fmath mrow{white-space:nowrap}.fm-vert{vertical-align:middle}fmath table,fmath tbody,fmath td,fmath tr{border:0!important;padding:0!important;margin:0!important;outline:0!important}fmath table{border-collapse:collapse!important;text-align:center!important;table-layout:auto!important;float:none!important}.fm-frac{padding:0 1px!important}td.fm-den-frac{border-top:solid thin!important}.fm-root{font-size:.6em}.fm-radicand{padding:0 1px 0 0;border-top:solid;margin-top:.1em}.fm-script{font-size:.71em}.fm-script .fm-script .fm-script{font-size:1em}td.fm-underover-base{line-height:1!important}td.fm-mtd{padding:.5ex .4em!important;vertical-align:baseline!important}fmath mphantom{visibility:hidden}fmath menclose[notation=top],menclose.fm-menclose[notation=top]{border-top:solid thin}fmath menclose[notation=right],menclose.fm-menclose[notation=right]{border-right:solid thin}fmath menclose[notation=bottom],menclose.fm-menclose[notation=bottom]{border-bottom:solid thin}fmath menclose[notation=left],menclose.fm-menclose[notation=left]{border-left:solid thin}fmath menclose[notation=box],menclose.fm-menclose[notation=box]{border:thin solid}fmath none{display:none}</style><div class="questionText col-12 hscrollenable h5 p-3 mt-3" id="mquestion">
<span class="h5">A bar of mass <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic" style="padding-right: 0.44ex;">M</mi><mo class="fm-infix-loose">=</mo><mrow class="ma-repel-adj"><mn>1.00</mn><mspace style="margin-right: 0.17em; padding-right: 0.001em; visibility: hidden;" width=".17em">&zwnj;</mspace><mi class="ma-repel-adj" mathvariant="normal">kg</mi></mrow></mrow></fmath> and length <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">L</mi><mo class="fm-infix-loose">=</mo><mrow><mn>0.20</mn><mi class="fm-mi-length-1 ma-upright" mathvariant="normal" style="padding-right: 0px;">m</mi></mrow></mrow></fmath> is lying on a horizontal frictionless surface. One end of the bar is pivoted at a point about which it is free to rotate. A small mass <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">m</mi><mo class="fm-infix-loose">=</mo><mrow class="ma-repel-adj"><mn>0.10</mn><mspace style="margin-right: 0.17em; padding-right: 0.001em; visibility: hidden;" width=".17em">&zwnj;</mspace><mi class="ma-repel-adj" mathvariant="normal">kg</mi></mrow></mrow></fmath> is moving on the same horizontal surface with <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><mn>5.00</mn><msup><mi class="ma-repel-adj" mathvariant="normal">ms</mi><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: 0.7em;"><mrow><mo class="fm-prefix-tight">−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></span></msup></mrow></fmath> speed on a path perpendicular to the bar. It hits the bar at a distance <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">L</mi><mo class="fm-infix-loose">∕</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></fmath> from the pivoted end and returns back on the same path with speed <fmath class="fm-inline"><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">v</mi></fmath>. After this elastic collision, the bar rotates with an angular velocity <fmath class="fm-inline"><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">ω</mi></fmath>. Which of the following statement is correct?<br></span>
</div></div>

                                                <div class="h5 text-green mb-3">Solutions</div>
                                                                                                    <div class="langdata1"><style>.fm-math,fmath{font-family:STIXGeneral,'DejaVu Serif','DejaVu <span class="h5">A container has a base of <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><mrow class="ma-repel-adj"><mn>50</mn><mspace style="margin-right: 0.17em; padding-right: 0.001em; visibility: hidden;" width=".17em">&zwnj;</mspace><mi class="ma-repel-adj" mathvariant="normal">cm</mi></mrow><mo class="fm-infix" lspace=".22em" rspace=".22em">×</mo><mrow class="ma-repel-adj"><mn>5</mn><mspace style="margin-right: 0.17em; padding-right: 0.001em; visibility: hidden;" width=".17em">&zwnj;</mspace><mi class="ma-repel-adj" mathvariant="normal">cm</mi></mrow></mrow></fmath> and height <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow class="ma-repel-adj"><mn>50</mn><mspace style="margin-right: 0.17em; padding-right: 0.001em; visibility: hidden;" width=".17em">&zwnj;</mspace><mi class="ma-repel-adj" mathvariant="normal">cm</mi></mrow></fmath>, as shown in the figure. It has two parallel electrically conducting walls each of area <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><mrow class="ma-repel-adj"><mn>50</mn><mspace style="margin-right: 0.17em; padding-right: 0.001em; visibility: hidden;" width=".17em">&zwnj;</mspace><mi class="ma-repel-adj" mathvariant="normal">cm</mi></mrow><mo class="fm-infix" lspace=".22em" rspace=".22em">×</mo><mrow class="ma-repel-adj"><mn>50</mn><mspace style="margin-right: 0.17em; padding-right: 0.001em; visibility: hidden;" width=".17em">&zwnj;</mspace><mi class="ma-repel-adj" mathvariant="normal">cm</mi></mrow></mrow></fmath>. The remaining walls of the container are thin and non-conducting. The container is being filled with a liquid of dielectric constant 3 at a uniform rate of <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><mrow><mn>250</mn><msup><mi class="ma-repel-adj" mathvariant="normal">cm</mi><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: 0.7em;"><mn>3</mn></span></msup></mrow><msup><mrow><mi class="fm-mi-length-1 ma-upright" mathvariant="normal" style="padding-right: 0px;"> </mi><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">s</mi></mrow><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: 0.7em;"><mrow><mo class="fm-prefix-tight">−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></span></msup></mrow></fmath>. What is the value of the capacitance of the container after 10 seconds?<br>[Given: Permittivity of free space <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><msub><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">ε</mi><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: -0.5em;"><mn>0</mn></span></msub><mo class="fm-infix-loose">=</mo><mrow><mn>9</mn><mo class="fm-infix" lspace=".22em" rspace=".22em">×</mo><mrow><mrow><mrow><msup><mn>10</mn><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: 0.7em;"><mrow><mo class="fm-prefix-tight">−</mo><mn>12</mn></mrow></span></msup><msup><mi class="fm-mi-length-1 ma-upright" mathvariant="normal" style="padding-right: 0px;">C</mi><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: 0.7em;"><mn>2</mn></span></msup></mrow><msup><mi class="fm-mi-length-1 ma-upright" mathvariant="normal" style="padding-right: 0px;">N</mi><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: 0.7em;"><mrow><mo class="fm-prefix-tight">−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></span></msup></mrow><msup><mi class="fm-mi-length-1 ma-upright" mathvariant="normal" style="padding-right: 0px;">m</mi><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: 0.7em;"><mrow><mo class="fm-prefix-tight">−</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></span></msup></mrow></mrow></mrow></fmath>, the effects of the non-conducting walls on the capacitance are negligible]<br></span><img src="https://www.topcoaching.in/ckeditor/plugins/imageuploader/uploads/24_03_14_65f2a3a6e6547.png" data-filename="1.png" style="width: 246px;"><span class="h5"><br><div class="hscrollenable"><span class="sprite JEE_Adv_2023_P1_5"></span></div></span>

<span class="h5">One mole of an ideal gas expands adiabatically from an initial state <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">(</mo><mrow><msub><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic" style="padding-right: 0.44ex;">T</mi><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: -0.5em;"><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">A</mi></span></msub><mo class="fm-separator">,</mo><msub><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic" style="padding-right: 0.44ex;">V</mi><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: -0.5em;"><mn>0</mn></span></msub></mrow><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">)</mo></mrow></fmath> to final state <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">(</mo><mrow><msub><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic" style="padding-right: 0.44ex;">T</mi><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: -0.5em;"><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic" style="padding-right: 0.44ex;">f</mi></span></msub><mo class="fm-separator">,</mo><mrow><mn>5</mn><msub><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic" style="padding-right: 0.44ex;">V</mi><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: -0.5em;"><mn>0</mn></span></msub></mrow></mrow><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">)</mo></mrow></fmath>. Another mole of the same gas expands isothermally from a different initial state <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">(</mo><mrow><msub><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic" style="padding-right: 0.44ex;">T</mi><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: -0.5em;"><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">B</mi></span></msub><mo class="fm-separator">,</mo><msub><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic" style="padding-right: 0.44ex;">V</mi><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: -0.5em;"><mn>0</mn></span></msub></mrow><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">)</mo></mrow></fmath> to the same final state <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">(</mo><mrow><mrow><msub><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic" style="padding-right: 0.44ex;">T</mi><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: -0.5em;"><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic" style="padding-right: 0.44ex;">f</mi></span></msub><mn>5</mn></mrow><msub><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic" style="padding-right: 0.44ex;">V</mi><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: -0.5em;"><mn>0</mn></span></msub></mrow><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">)</mo></mrow></fmath>. The ratio of the specific heats at constant pressure and constant volume of this ideal gas is <fmath class="fm-inline"><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">γ</mi></fmath>. What is the ratio <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><msub><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic" style="padding-right: 0.44ex;">T</mi><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: -0.5em;"><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">A</mi></span></msub><mo class="fm-infix-loose">∕</mo><msub><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic" style="padding-right: 0.44ex;">T</mi><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: -0.5em;"><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">B</mi></span></msub></mrow></fmath> ?<br></span>
</div></div>

                                <li id="questionBox7" class="hideThis questLiClass">
                                    <div class="ques-no d-flex align-items-center p-3">
                                        <h6><strong>(7/51)</strong>  JEE Advanced 2023 Paper - 1</h6>
                                        <span>3 / -1</span>

                                    <div class="make-review bg-green mb-3 hideThis" id="questCorrectMarker473781">Q.7 Correct</div>

                                                                            <div class="px-3 mb-0 qsn-here"></div>
                                        <div class="px-3 mb-0 qsn-here"><style>.fm-math,fmath{font-family:STIXGeneral,'DejaVu Serif','DejaVu Sans',Times,OpenSymbol,'Standard Symbols menclose[notation=box],menclose.fm-menclose[notation=box]{border:thin solid}fmath none{display:none}</style><div class="questionText col-12 hscrollenable h5 p-3 mt-3" id="mquestion">
<span class="h5">Two satellites <fmath class="fm-inline"><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">P</mi></fmath> and <fmath class="fm-inline"><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">Q</mi></fmath> are moving in different circular orbits around the Earth (radius <fmath class="fm-inline"><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">R</mi></fmath> ). The heights of <fmath class="fm-inline"><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">P</mi></fmath> and <fmath class="fm-inline"><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">Q</mi></fmath> from the Earth surface are <fmath class="fm-inline"><msub><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">h</mi><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: -0.5em;"><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">P</mi></span></msub></fmath> and <fmath class="fm-inline"><msub><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">h</mi><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: -0.5em;"><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">Q</mi></span></msub></fmath>, respectively, where <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><msub><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">h</mi><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: -0.5em;"><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">P</mi></span></msub><mo class="fm-infix-loose">=</mo><mrow><mspace style="margin-right: 0.28em; padding-right: 0.001em; visibility: hidden;" width=".28em">&zwnj;</mspace><span mtagname="mfrac" style="vertical-align: 0em;"><span class="fm-vert fm-frac"><table><tbody><tr><td class="fm-num-frac fm-inline"><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">R</mi></td></tr><tr><td class="fm-den-frac fm-inline"><mn>3</mn></td></tr></tbody></table></span></span></mrow></mrow></fmath>. The accelerations of <fmath class="fm-inline"><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">P</mi></fmath> and <fmath class="fm-inline"><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">Q</mi></fmath> due to Earth's gravity are <fmath class="fm-inline"><msub><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">g</mi><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: -0.5em;"><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">P</mi></span></msub></fmath> and <fmath class="fm-inline"><msub><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">g</mi><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: -0.5em;"><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">Q</mi></span></msub></fmath>. respectively. If <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><mrow><mspace style="margin-right: 0.28em; padding-right: 0.001em; visibility: hidden;" width=".28em">&zwnj;</mspace><span mtagname="mfrac" style="vertical-align: 0em;"><span class="fm-vert fm-frac"><table><tbody><tr><td class="fm-num-frac fm-inline"><msub><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">g</mi><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: -0.5em;"><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">P</mi></span></msub></td></tr><tr><td class="fm-den-frac fm-inline"><msub><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">g</mi><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: -0.5em;"><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">Q</mi></span></msub></td></tr></tbody></table></span></span></mrow><mo class="fm-infix-loose">=</mo><mrow><mspace style="margin-right: 0.28em; padding-right: 0.001em; visibility: hidden;" width=".28em">&zwnj;</mspace><span mtagname="mfrac" style="vertical-align: 0em;"><span class="fm-vert fm-frac"><table><tbody><tr><td class="fm-num-frac fm-inline"><mn>36</mn></td></tr><tr><td class="fm-den-frac fm-inline"><mn>25</mn></td></tr></tbody></table></span></span></mrow></mrow></fmath>, what is the value of <fmath class="fm-inline"><msub><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">h</mi><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: -0.5em;"><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">Q</mi></span></msub></fmath> ?<br></span>
</div></div>

border-bottom border-danger questionsfont noselect" id="answerstatus">
<div class="text-primary border-bottom p-2 mb-2 d-flex justify-content-between align-items-center">
<strong>Solution:</strong>
</div>
<div style="position: relative;z-index:1">   
                                    Given <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><msub><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">h</mi><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: -0.5em;"><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">P</mi></span></msub><mo class="fm-infix-loose">=</mo><mrow><mspace style="margin-right: 0.28em; padding-right: 0.001em; visibility: hidden;"                                         <h6><strong>(8/51)</strong>  JEE Advanced 2023 Paper - 1</h6>
                                        <span>4 / -0</span>

<span class="h5">A Hydrogen-like atom has atomic number <fmath class="fm-inline"><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic" style="padding-right: 0.44ex;">Z</mi></fmath>. Photons emitted in the electronic transitions from level <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">n</mi><mo class="fm-infix-loose">=</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></fmath> to level <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">n</mi><mo class="fm-infix-loose">=</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></fmath> in these atoms are used to perform photoelectric effect experiment on a target metal. The maximum kinetic energy of the photoelectrons generated is <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow class="ma-repel-adj"><mn>1.95</mn><mspace style="margin-right: 0.17em; padding-right: 0.001em; visibility: hidden;" width=".17em">&zwnj;</mspace><mi class="ma-repel-adj" mathvariant="normal">eV</mi></mrow></fmath>. If the photoelectric threshold wavelength for the target metal is <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow class="ma-repel-adj"><mn>310</mn><mspace style="margin-right: 0.17em; padding-right: 0.001em; visibility: hidden;" width=".17em">&zwnj;</mspace><mi class="ma-repel-adj" mathvariant="normal">nm</mi></mrow></fmath>, the value of <fmath class="fm-inline"><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic" style="padding-right: 0.44ex;">Z</mi></fmath> is____________ <br>[Given <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><mrow><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">h</mi><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">c</mi></mrow><mo class="fm-infix-loose">=</mo><mrow class="ma-repel-adj"><mn>1240</mn><mspace style="margin-right: 0.17em; padding-right: 0.001em; visibility: hidden;" width=".17em">&zwnj;</mspace><mi class="ma-repel-adj" mathvariant="normal">eV</mi></mrow></mrow></fmath>-nm and <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><mrow><mrow><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">R</mi><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">h</mi></mrow><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">c</mi></mrow><mo class="fm-infix-loose">=</mo><mrow class="ma-repel-adj"><mn>13.6</mn><mspace style="margin-right: 0.17em; padding-right: 0.001em; visibility: hidden;" width=".17em">&zwnj;</mspace><mi class="ma-repel-adj" mathvariant="normal">eV</mi></mrow></mrow></fmath>, where <fmath class="fm-inline"><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">R</mi></fmath> is the Rydberg constant, <fmath class="fm-inline"><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">h</mi></fmath> is the Planck's constant and <fmath class="fm-inline"><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">c</mi></fmath> is the speed of light in vacuum]</span>
</div></div>

                                <li id="questionBox9" class="hideThis questLiClass">
                                    <div class="ques-no d-flex align-items-center p-3">
                                        <h6><strong>(9/51)</strong>  JEE Advanced 2023 Paper - 1</h6>
                                        <span>4 / -2</span>
                                    </div>
                                    <hr class="w-100 hr-gray mt-0">
                                    
                                    <div class="make-review bg-green mb-3 hideThis" id="questCorrectMarker473783">Q.9 Correct</div>
                                    <div class="make-review bg-red mb-3 hideThis" id="questInCorrectMarker473783">Q.9 In-Correct</div>
                                    <div class="make-review bg-yellow mb-3" id="questUnAttemptedMarker473783">Q.9 Un-Attempted</div>
                                    
                                                                            <div class="px-3 mb-0 qsn-here"></div>
                                        <div class="px-3 mb-0 qsn-here"><style>.fm-math,fmath{font-family:STIXGeneral,'DejaVu Serif','DejaVu Sans',Times,OpenSymbol,'Standard Symbols L',serif;line-height:1.2}.fm-math mtext,fmath mtext{line-height:normal}.fm-mo,.ma-sans-serif,fmath mi[mathvariant*=sans-serif],fmath mn[mathvariant*=sans-serif],fmath mo,fmath L',sans-serif}.fm-mo-Luc{font-family:STIXGeneral,'DejaVu Sans','DejaVu Serif','Lucida Grande','Arial Unicode MS',Times,OpenSymbol,'Standard Symbols L',sans-serif}.questionsfont{font-weight:200;font-family:Arial, sans-serif, STIXGeneral,'DejaVu Sans','DejaVu Serif','Lucida Grande','Arial Unicode MS',Times,OpenSymbol,'Standard Symbols L',sans-serif!important}</style><style>.fm-separator{padding:0 .56ex 0 0}.fm-infix-loose{padding:0 .56ex}.fm-infix{padding:0 .44ex}.fm-prefix{padding:0 .33ex 0 0}.fm-postfix{padding:0 0 0 .33ex}.fm-prefix-tight{padding:0 .11ex 0 0}.fm-postfix-tight{padding:0 0 0 .11ex}.fm-quantifier{padding:0 .11ex 0 .22ex}.ma-non-marking{display:none}.fm-vert,fmath menclose,menclose.fm-menclose{display:inline-block}.fm-large-op{font-size:1.3em}.fm-inline .fm-large-op{font-size:1em}fmath mrow{white-space:nowrap}.fm-vert{vertical-align:middle}fmath table,fmath table{border-collapse:collapse!important;text-align:center!important;table-layout:auto!important;float:none!important}.fm-frac{padding:0 1px!important}td.fm-den-frac{border-top:solid thin!important}.fm-root{font-size:.6em}.fm-radicand{padding:0 1px 0 0;border-top:solid;margin-top:.1em}.fm-script{font-size:.71em}.fm-script .fm-script .fm-script{font-size:1em}td.fm-underover-base{line-height:1!important}td.fm-mtd{padding:.5ex .4em!important;vertical-align:baseline!important}fmath mphantom{visibility:hidden}fmath menclose[notation=top],menclose.fm-menclose[notation=top]{border-top:solid thin}fmath menclose[notation=right],menclose.fm-menclose[notation=right]{border-right:solid thin}fmath menclose[notation=bottom],menclose.fm-menclose[notation=bottom]{border-bottom:solid thin}fmath menclose[notation=left],menclose.fm-menclose[notation=left]{border-left:solid thin}fmath menclose[notation=box],menclose.fm-menclose[notation=box]{border:thin solid}fmath none{display:none}</style><div class="questionText col-12 hscrollenable h5 p-3 mt-3" id="mquestion">
<span class="h5">An optical arrangement consists of two concave mirrors <fmath class="fm-inline"><msub><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic" style="padding-right: 0.44ex;">M</mi><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: -0.5em;"><mn>1</mn></span></msub></fmath> and <fmath class="fm-inline"><msub><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic" style="padding-right: 0.44ex;">M</mi><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: -0.5em;"><mn>2</mn></span></msub></fmath>, and a convex lens <fmath class="fm-inline"><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">L</mi></fmath> with a common principal axis, as shown in the figure. The focal length of <fmath class="fm-inline"><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">L</mi></fmath> is <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow class="ma-repel-adj"><mn>10</mn><mspace style="margin-right: 0.17em; padding-right: 0.001em; visibility: hidden;" width=".17em">&zwnj;</mspace><mi class="ma-repel-adj" mathvariant="normal">cm</mi></mrow></fmath>. The radii of curvature of <fmath class="fm-inline"><msub><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic" style="padding-right: 0.44ex;">M</mi><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: -0.5em;"><mn>1</mn></span></msub></fmath> and <fmath class="fm-inline"><msub><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic" style="padding-right: 0.44ex;">M</mi><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: -0.5em;"><mn>2</mn></span></msub></fmath> are <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow class="ma-repel-adj"><mn>20</mn><mspace style="margin-right: 0.17em; padding-right: 0.001em; visibility: hidden;" width=".17em">&zwnj;</mspace><mi class="ma-repel-adj" mathvariant="normal">cm</mi></mrow></fmath> and <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow class="ma-repel-adj"><mn>24</mn><mspace style="margin-right: 0.17em; padding-right: 0.001em; visibility: hidden;" width=".17em">&zwnj;</mspace><mi class="ma-repel-adj" mathvariant="normal">cm</mi></mrow></fmath>, respectively. The distance between <fmath class="fm-inline"><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">L</mi></fmath> and <fmath class="fm-inline"><msub><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic" style="padding-right: 0.44ex;">M</mi><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: -0.5em;"><mn>2</mn></span></msub></fmath> is <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow class="ma-repel-adj"><mn>20</mn><mspace style="margin-right: 0.17em; padding-right: 0.001em; visibility: hidden;" width=".17em">&zwnj;</mspace><mi class="ma-repel-adj" mathvariant="normal">cm</mi></mrow></fmath>. A point object <fmath class="fm-inline"><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">S</mi></fmath> is placed at the mid-point between <fmath class="fm-inline"><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">L</mi></fmath> and <fmath class="fm-inline"><msub><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic" style="padding-right: 0.44ex;">M</mi><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: -0.5em;"><mn>2</mn></span></msub></fmath> on the axis. When the distance between <fmath class="fm-inline"><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">L</mi></fmath> and <fmath class="fm-inline"><msub><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic" style="padding-right: 0.44ex;">M</mi><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: -0.5em;"><mn>1</mn></span></msub></fmath> is <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><mspace style="margin-right: 0.28em; padding-right: 0.001em; visibility: hidden;" width=".28em">&zwnj;</mspace><mrow class="ma-repel-adj"><span mtagname="mfrac" style="vertical-align: 0em;"><span class="fm-vert fm-frac"><table><tbody><tr><td class="fm-num-frac fm-inline"><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">n</mi></td></tr><tr><td class="fm-den-frac fm-inline"><mn>7</mn></td></tr></tbody></table></span></span><mspace style="margin-right: 0.17em; padding-right: 0.001em; visibility: hidden;" width=".17em">&zwnj;</mspace><mi class="ma-repel-adj" mathvariant="normal">cm</mi></mrow></mrow></fmath>, one of the images coincides with <fmath class="fm-inline"><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">S</mi></fmath>. The value of <fmath class="fm-inline"><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">n</mi></fmath> is__________<br></span><img src="https://www.topcoaching.in/ckeditor/plugins/imageuploader/uploads/24_03_14_65f2a4f02fefd.png" data-filename="1.png" style="width: 100%;"><span class="h5"><br><div class="hscrollenable"><span class="sprite JEE_Adv_2023_P1_9"></span></div></span>
</div></div>

<span class="h5">In an experiment for determination of the focal length of a thin convex lens, the distance of the object from the lens is <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><mn>10</mn><mo class="fm-infix">±</mo><mrow class="ma-repel-adj"><mn>0.1</mn><mspace style="margin-right: 0.17em; padding-right: 0.001em; visibility: hidden;" width=".17em">&zwnj;</mspace><mi class="ma-repel-adj" mathvariant="normal">cm</mi></mrow></mrow></fmath> and the distance of its real image from the lens is <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><mn>20</mn><mo class="fm-infix">±</mo><mrow class="ma-repel-adj"><mn>0.2</mn><mspace style="margin-right: 0.17em; padding-right: 0.001em; visibility: hidden;" width=".17em">&zwnj;</mspace><mi class="ma-repel-adj" mathvariant="normal">cm</mi></mrow></mrow></fmath>. The error in the determination of focal length of the lens is <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">n</mi><mo>%</mo></mrow></fmath>. The value of <fmath class="fm-inline"><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">n</mi></fmath> is________</span>

                                    <div class="ques-no d-flex align-items-center p-3">
                                        <h6><strong>(11/51)</strong>  JEE Advanced 2023 Paper - 1</h6>
                                        <span>4 / -0</span>

<span class="h5">A closed container contains a homogeneous mixture of two moles of an ideal monatomic gas <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">(</mo><mrow><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">γ</mi><mo class="fm-infix-loose">=</mo><mrow><mn>5</mn><mo class="fm-infix-loose">∕</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mrow><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">)</mo></mrow></fmath> and one mole of an ideal diatomic gas <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">(</mo><mrow><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">γ</mi><mo class="fm-infix-loose">=</mo><mrow><mn>7</mn><mo class="fm-infix-loose">∕</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow></mrow><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">)</mo></mrow></fmath>. Here, <fmath class="fm-inline"><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">γ</mi></fmath> is the ratio of the specific heats at constant pressure and constant volume of an ideal gas. The gas mixture does a work of 66 Joule when heated at constant pressure. The change in its internal energy is Joule.</span>
</div></div>

<span class="h5">A person of height <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><mn>1.6</mn><mi class="fm-mi-length-1 ma-upright" mathvariant="normal" style="padding-right: 0px;">m</mi></mrow></fmath> is walking away from a lamp post of height <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><mn>4</mn><mi class="fm-mi-length-1 ma-upright" mathvariant="normal" style="padding-right: 0px;">m</mi></mrow></fmath> along a straight path on the flat ground. The lamp post and the person are always perpendicular to the ground. If the speed of the person is <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow class="ma-repel-adj"><mrow class="ma-repel-adj"><mn>60</mn><mspace style="margin-right: 0.17em; padding-right: 0.001em; visibility: hidden;" width=".17em">&zwnj;</mspace><mi class="ma-repel-adj" mathvariant="normal">cm</mi></mrow><mspace style="margin-right: 0.17em; padding-right: 0.001em; visibility: hidden;" width=".17em">&zwnj;</mspace><msup><mrow><mi class="fm-mi-length-1 ma-upright" mathvariant="normal" style="padding-right: 0px;"> </mi><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">s</mi></mrow><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: 0.7em;"><mrow><mo class="fm-prefix-tight">−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></span></msup></mrow></fmath>, the speed of the tip of the person's shadow on the ground with respect to the person is __________ <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow class="ma-repel-adj"><mi class="ma-repel-adj" mathvariant="normal">cm</mi><mspace style="margin-right: 0.17em; padding-right: 0.001em; visibility: hidden;" width=".17em">&zwnj;</mspace><msup><mrow><mi class="fm-mi-length-1 ma-upright" mathvariant="normal" style="padding-right: 0px;"> </mi><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">s</mi></mrow><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: 0.7em;"><mrow><mo class="fm-prefix-tight">−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></span></msup></mrow></fmath>.</span>
</div></div>

<div class="text-primary border-bottom p-2 mb-2 d-flex justify-content-between align-items-center">
<strong>Solution:</strong>
</div>
<div style="position: relative;z-index:1">   
                                    Given that  <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><span mtagname="mfrac" style="vertical-align: 0.126em;"><span class="fm-vert fm-frac"><table><tbody><tr><td class="fm-num-frac fm-inline"><mrow><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic" style="padding-right: 0.44ex;">d</mi><msub><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">x</mi><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: -0.5em;"><mn>1</mn></span></msub></mrow></td></tr><tr><td class="fm-den-frac fm-inline"><mrow><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic" style="padding-right: 0.44ex;">d</mi><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">t</mi></mrow></td></tr></tbody></table></span></span><mo class="fm-infix-loose">=</mo></mrow></fmath> speed of person <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><mo class="fm-infix-loose">=</mo><mrow class="ma-repel-adj"><mrow class="ma-repel-adj"><mrow class="ma-repel-adj"><mn>60</mn><mspace style="margin-right: 0.17em;                                 <li id="questionBox13" class="hideThis questLiClass">
                                    <div class="ques-no d-flex align-items-center p-3">
                                        <h6><strong>(13/51)</strong>  JEE Advanced 2023 Paper - 1</h6>
                                        <span>4 / -0</span>
                                    </div>
                                    <hr class="w-100 hr-gray mt-0">
                                    
                                    <div class="make-review bg-green mb-3 hideThis" id="questCorrectMarker473787">Q.13 Correct</div>
                                    <div class="make-review bg-red mb-3 hideThis" id="questInCorrectMarker473787">Q.13 In-Correct</div>
                                    <div class="make-review bg-yellow mb-3" id="questUnAttemptedMarker473787">Q.13 Un-Attempted</div>
                                    
                                                                            <div class="px-3 mb-0 qsn-here"></div>
                                        <div class="px-3 mb-0 qsn-here"><style>.fm-math,fmath{font-family:STIXGeneral,'DejaVu Serif','DejaVu Sans',Times,OpenSymbol,'Standard Symbols L',serif;line-height:1.2}.fm-math mtext,fmath mtext{line-height:normal}.fm-mo,.ma-sans-serif,fmath mi[mathvariant*=sans-serif],fmath mn[mathvariant*=sans-serif],fmath mo,fmath L',sans-serif!important}</style><style>.fm-separator{padding:0 .56ex 0 0}.fm-infix-loose{padding:0 .56ex}.fm-infix{padding:0 .44ex}.fm-prefix{padding:0 .33ex 0 0}.fm-postfix{padding:0 0 0 .33ex}.fm-prefix-tight{padding:0 .11ex 0 0}.fm-postfix-tight{padding:0 0 0 .11ex}.fm-quantifier{padding:0 .11ex 0 .22ex}.ma-non-marking{display:none}.fm-vert,fmath menclose,menclose.fm-menclose{display:inline-block}.fm-large-op{font-size:1.3em}.fm-inline .fm-large-op{font-size:1em}fmath mrow{white-space:nowrap}.fm-vert{vertical-align:middle}fmath table,fmath .fm-script{font-size:1em}td.fm-underover-base{line-height:1!important}td.fm-mtd{padding:.5ex .4em!important;vertical-align:baseline!important}fmath mphantom{visibility:hidden}fmath menclose[notation=top],menclose.fm-menclose[notation=top]{border-top:solid thin}fmath menclose[notation=right],menclose.fm-menclose[notation=right]{border-right:solid thin}fmath menclose[notation=bottom],menclose.fm-menclose[notation=bottom]{border-bottom:solid thin}fmath menclose[notation=left],menclose.fm-menclose[notation=left]{border-left:solid thin}fmath menclose[notation=box],menclose.fm-menclose[notation=box]{border:thin solid}fmath none{display:none}</style><div class="questionText col-12 hscrollenable h5 p-3 mt-3" id="mquestion">
<span class="h5">Two point-like objects of masses <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow class="ma-repel-adj"><mn>20</mn><mspace style="margin-right: 0.17em; padding-right: 0.001em; visibility: hidden;" width=".17em">&zwnj;</mspace><mi class="ma-repel-adj" mathvariant="normal">gm</mi></mrow></fmath> and <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow class="ma-repel-adj"><mn>30</mn><mspace style="margin-right: 0.17em; padding-right: 0.001em; visibility: hidden;" width=".17em">&zwnj;</mspace><mi class="ma-repel-adj" mathvariant="normal">gm</mi></mrow></fmath> are fixed at the two ends of a rigid massless rod of length <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow class="ma-repel-adj"><mn>10</mn><mspace style="margin-right: 0.17em; padding-right: 0.001em; visibility: hidden;" width=".17em">&zwnj;</mspace><mi class="ma-repel-adj" mathvariant="normal">cm</mi></mrow></fmath>. This system is suspended vertically from a rigid ceiling using a thin wire attached to its center of mass, as shown in the figure. The resulting torsional pendulum undergoes small oscillations. The torsional constant of the wire is <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><mn>1.2</mn><mo class="fm-infix" lspace=".22em" rspace=".22em">×</mo><mrow><mrow><mrow><msup><mn>10</mn><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: 0.7em;"><mrow><mo class="fm-prefix-tight">−</mo><mn>8</mn></mrow></span></msup><mi class="fm-mi-length-1 ma-upright" mathvariant="normal" style="padding-right: 0px;">N</mi></mrow><mi class="fm-mi-length-1 ma-upright" mathvariant="normal" style="padding-right: 0px;">m</mi></mrow><msup><mi class="ma-repel-adj" mathvariant="normal">rad</mi><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: 0.7em;"><mrow><mo class="fm-prefix-tight">−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></span></msup></mrow></mrow></fmath>. The angular frequency of the oscillations in <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">n</mi><mo class="fm-infix" lspace=".22em" rspace=".22em">×</mo><mrow class="ma-repel-adj"><mrow class="ma-repel-adj"><msup><mn>10</mn><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: 0.7em;"><mrow><mo class="fm-prefix-tight">−</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></span></msup><mspace style="margin-right: 0.17em; padding-right: 0.001em; visibility: hidden;" width=".17em">&zwnj;</mspace><mi class="ma-repel-adj" mathvariant="normal">rad</mi></mrow><mspace style="margin-right: 0.17em; padding-right: 0.001em; visibility: hidden;" width=".17em">&zwnj;</mspace><msup><mrow><mi class="fm-mi-length-1 ma-upright" mathvariant="normal" style="padding-right: 0px;"> </mi><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">s</mi></mrow><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: 0.7em;"><mrow><mo class="fm-prefix-tight">−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></span></msup></mrow></mrow></fmath>. The value of <fmath class="fm-inline"><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">n</mi></fmath> is________.<br></span><img src="https://www.topcoaching.in/ckeditor/plugins/imageuploader/uploads/24_03_14_65f2a5cdc5b7c.png" data-filename="1.png" style="width: 172px;"><span class="h5"><br><div class="hscrollenable"><span class="sprite JEE_Adv_2023_P1_13"></span></div></span>
</div></div>

                                                        <h6>Correct Ans: 10</h6>
                                                    </label>

</div>

</div></div>

                                        <h6><strong>(14/51)</strong>  JEE Advanced 2023 Paper - 1</h6>
                                        <span>3 / -1</span>

menclose[notation=box],menclose.fm-menclose[notation=box]{border:thin solid}fmath none{display:none}</style><div class="questionText col-12 hscrollenable h5 p-3 mt-3" id="mquestion">
<span class="h5">List-I shows different radioactive decay processes and List-II provides possible emitted particles. Match each entry in List-I with an appropriate entry from List-II, and choose the correct option.<div class="hscrollenable"><img src="https://www.topcoaching.in/ckeditor/plugins/imageuploader/uploads/24_03_14_65f2a6078750e.png" data-filename="1.png" style="width: 100%;"><br></div></span>

border-bottom border-danger questionsfont noselect" id="answerstatus">
<div class="text-primary border-bottom p-2 mb-2 d-flex justify-content-between align-items-center">
<strong>Solution:</strong>
</div>
<div style="position: relative;z-index:1">   
                                    ∗ In <fmath class="fm-inline"><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">α</mi></fmath> decay mass number decreases by 4 unit and atomic number decreases by 2 unit.<br>∗ In <fmath class="fm-inline"><msup><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">β</mi><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: 0.7em;"><mo>−</mo></span></msup></fmath>decay mass number does not change but atomic number increases by 1 unit.<br>∗ In <fmath class="fm-inline"><msup><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">β</mi><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: 0.7em;"><mo>+</mo></span></msup></fmath>decay mass number does not change but atomic number decreases by 1 unit. 
                            </div>

</div></div>
                                                                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                                                    </li>
                                                                                            
                                <li id="questionBox15" class="hideThis questLiClass">
                                    <div class="ques-no d-flex align-items-center p-3">
                                        <h6><strong>(15/51)</strong>  JEE Advanced 2023 Paper - 1</h6>
                                        <span>3 / -1</span>
                                    </div>
                                    <hr class="w-100 hr-gray mt-0">
                                    
                                    <div class="make-review bg-green mb-3 hideThis" id="questCorrectMarker473789">Q.15 Correct</div>
                                    <div class="make-review bg-red mb-3 hideThis" id="questInCorrectMarker473789">Q.15 In-Correct</div>
                                    <div class="make-review bg-yellow mb-3" id="questUnAttemptedMarker473789">Q.15 Un-Attempted</div>
                                    
                                                                            <div class="px-3 mb-0 qsn-here"></div>
                                        <div class="px-3 mb-0 qsn-here"><style>.fm-math,fmath{font-family:STIXGeneral,'DejaVu Serif','DejaVu Sans',Times,OpenSymbol,'Standard Symbols <span class="h5">A series LCR circuit is connected to a <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><mrow><mrow><mrow><mn>45</mn><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">s</mi></mrow><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">i</mi></mrow><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">n</mi></mrow><mspace style="margin-right: 0.28em; padding-right: 0.001em; visibility: hidden;" width=".28em">&zwnj;</mspace><mrow><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">(</mo><mrow><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">ω</mi><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">t</mi></mrow><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">)</mo></mrow></mrow></fmath> Volt source. The resonant angular frequency of the circuit is <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow class="ma-repel-adj"><mrow class="ma-repel-adj"><msup><mn>10</mn><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: 0.7em;"><mn>5</mn></span></msup><mspace style="margin-right: 0.17em; padding-right: 0.001em; visibility: hidden;" width=".17em">&zwnj;</mspace><mi class="ma-repel-adj" mathvariant="normal">rad</mi></mrow><mspace style="margin-right: 0.17em; padding-right: 0.001em; visibility: hidden;" width=".17em">&zwnj;</mspace><msup><mrow><mi class="fm-mi-length-1 ma-upright" mathvariant="normal" style="padding-right: 0px;"> </mi><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">s</mi></mrow><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: 0.7em;"><mrow><mo class="fm-prefix-tight">−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></span></msup></mrow></fmath> and current amplitude at resonance is <fmath class="fm-inline"><msub><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic" style="padding-right: 0.44ex;">I</mi><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: -0.5em;"><mn>0</mn></span></msub></fmath>. When the angular frequency of the source is <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">ω</mi><mo class="fm-infix-loose">=</mo><mrow><mn>8</mn><mo class="fm-infix" lspace=".22em" rspace=".22em">×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: 0.7em;"><mn>4</mn></span></msup></mrow></mrow></fmath> rad s<fmath class="fm-inline"><msup><mspace style="margin-right: 0px; padding-right: 0.001em; visibility: hidden;">&zwnj;</mspace><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: 0.7em;"><mrow><mo class="fm-prefix-tight">−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></span></msup></fmath>, the current amplitude in the circuit is <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><mn>0.05</mn><msub><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic" style="padding-right: 0.44ex;">I</mi><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: -0.5em;"><mn>0</mn></span></msub></mrow></fmath>. If <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">L</mi><mo class="fm-infix-loose">=</mo><mrow class="ma-repel-adj"><mn>50</mn><mspace style="margin-right: 0.17em; padding-right: 0.001em; visibility: hidden;" width=".17em">&zwnj;</mspace><mi class="ma-repel-adj" mathvariant="normal">mH</mi></mrow></mrow></fmath>, match each entry in List-I with an appropriate value from List-II and choose the correct option. <div class="hscrollenable"><img src="https://www.topcoaching.in/ckeditor/plugins/imageuploader/uploads/24_03_14_65f2a6924726b.png" data-filename="1.png" style="width: 100%;"><br> </div></span>

                                <li id="questionBox17" class="hideThis questLiClass">
                                    <div class="ques-no d-flex align-items-center p-3">
                                        <h6><strong>(17/51)</strong>  JEE Advanced 2023 Paper - 1</h6>

<span class="h5">A thin conducting rod MN of mass <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow class="ma-repel-adj"><mn>20</mn><mspace style="margin-right: 0.17em; padding-right: 0.001em; visibility: hidden;" width=".17em">&zwnj;</mspace><mi class="ma-repel-adj" mathvariant="normal">gm</mi></mrow></fmath>, length <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow class="ma-repel-adj"><mn>25</mn><mspace style="margin-right: 0.17em; padding-right: 0.001em; visibility: hidden;" width=".17em">&zwnj;</mspace><mi class="ma-repel-adj" mathvariant="normal">cm</mi></mrow></fmath> and resistance <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><mn>10</mn><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">Ω</mi></mrow></fmath> is held on frictionless, long, perfectly conducting vertical rails as shown in the figure. There is a uniform magnetic field <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><msub><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">B</mi><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: -0.5em;"><mn>0</mn></span></msub><mo class="fm-infix-loose">=</mo><mrow><mn>4</mn><mi class="fm-mi-length-1 ma-upright" mathvariant="normal" style="padding-right: 0px;">T</mi></mrow></mrow></fmath> directed perpendicular to the plane of the rod-rail arrangement. The rod is released from rest at time <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">t</mi><mo class="fm-infix-loose">=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></fmath> and it moves down along the rails. Assume air drag is negligible. Match each quantity in List-I with an appropriate value from List-II, and choose the correct option.<br>[Given: The acceleration due to gravity <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">g</mi><mo class="fm-infix-loose">=</mo><mrow><mrow><mn>10</mn><mi class="fm-mi-length-1 ma-upright" mathvariant="normal" style="padding-right: 0px;">m</mi></mrow><msup><mrow><mi class="fm-mi-length-1 ma-upright" mathvariant="normal" style="padding-right: 0px;"> </mi><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">s</mi></mrow><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: 0.7em;"><mrow><mo class="fm-prefix-tight">−</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></span></msup></mrow></mrow></fmath> and <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><msup><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">e</mi><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: 0.7em;"><mrow><mo class="fm-prefix-tight">−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></span></msup><mo class="fm-infix-loose">=</mo><mn>0.4</mn></mrow></fmath> ]<div class="hscrollenable"><span class="sprite JEE_Adv_2023_P1_17"></span></div><div class="hscrollenable"><img src="https://www.topcoaching.in/ckeditor/plugins/imageuploader/uploads/24_03_14_65f2a6d913b98.png" data-filename="1.png" style="width: 100%;"><br></div></span>
</div></div>

                                    <div class="ques-no d-flex align-items-center p-3">
                                        <h6><strong>(18/51)</strong>  JEE Advanced 2023 Paper - 1</h6>
                                        <span>4 / -2</span>

                                <li id="questionBox19" class="hideThis questLiClass">
                                    <div class="ques-no d-flex align-items-center p-3">
                                        <h6><strong>(19/51)</strong>  JEE Advanced 2023 Paper - 1</h6>

                                                </button>

                                            <div class="qn-solution p-3 bg-green-grad mx-4 mb-5" style="filter: blur(5px);">
                                                <div class="h5 text-green mb-3">Solutions</div>

<strong>Solution:</strong>

                                <li id="questionBox20" class="hideThis questLiClass">

                                    <div class="ques-no d-flex align-items-center p-3">
                                        <h6><strong>(22/51)</strong>  JEE Advanced 2023 Paper - 1</h6>
                                        <span>3 / -1</span>

                                    <div class="make-review bg-green mb-3 hideThis" id="questCorrectMarker473796">Q.22 Correct</div>

                                        <div class="px-3 mb-0 qsn-here"><style>.fm-math,fmath{font-family:STIXGeneral,'DejaVu Serif','DejaVu Sans',Times,OpenSymbol,'Standard Symbols .33ex}.fm-prefix-tight{padding:0 .11ex 0 0}.fm-postfix-tight{padding:0 0 0 .11ex}.fm-quantifier{padding:0 .11ex 0 .22ex}.ma-non-marking{display:none}.fm-vert,fmath <span class="h5">Plotting <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>/</mo></mrow><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">Λ</mi></mrow><mi class="fm-mi-length-1 ma-upright" mathvariant="normal" style="padding-right: 0px;">m</mi></mrow></fmath> against <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><mrow><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">c</mi><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">Λ</mi></mrow><mi class="fm-mi-length-1 ma-upright" mathvariant="normal" style="padding-right: 0px;">m</mi></mrow></fmath> for aqueous solutions of a monobasic weak acid <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">(</mo><mi class="ma-repel-adj" mathvariant="normal">HX</mi><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">)</mo></mrow></fmath> resulted in a straight line with <fmath class="fm-inline"><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">y</mi></fmath>-axis intercept of <fmath class="fm-inline"><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">P</mi></fmath> and slope of <fmath class="fm-inline"><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">S</mi></fmath>. The ratio <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">P</mi><mo class="fm-infix-loose">∕</mo><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">S</mi></mrow></fmath> is<br><fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow class="ma-repel-adj"><mo class="fm-mo-Luc fm-prefix">[</mo><mrow><msub><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">Λ</mi><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: -0.5em;"><mi class="fm-mi-length-1 ma-upright" mathvariant="normal" style="padding-right: 0px;">m</mi></span></msub><mo class="fm-infix-loose">=</mo><mo>.</mo></mrow></mrow></fmath> molar conductivity<br><fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><msubsup><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">Λ</mi><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: -0.5em;"><mi class="fm-mi-length-1 ma-upright" mathvariant="normal" style="padding-right: 0px;">m</mi></span><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: 0.7em;"><mo>∘</mo></span></msubsup><mo class="fm-infix-loose">=</mo></mrow></fmath> limiting molar conductivity<br><fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><mi class="fm-mi-length-1 ma-upright" mathvariant="normal" style="padding-right: 0px;">c</mi><mo class="fm-infix-loose">=</mo></mrow></fmath> molar concentration<br><fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><msub><mi class="fm-mi-length-1 ma-upright" mathvariant="normal" style="padding-right: 0px;">K</mi><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: -0.5em;"><mi class="fm-mi-length-1 ma-upright" mathvariant="normal" style="padding-right: 0px;">a</mi></span></msub><mo class="fm-infix-loose">=</mo></mrow></fmath> dissociation constant of <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow class="ma-repel-adj"><mi class="ma-repel-adj" mathvariant="normal">HX</mi><mo class="fm-mo-Luc fm-postfix">]</mo></mrow></fmath><br></span>
</div></div>

                                                <div class="h5 text-green mb-3">Solutions</div>

                                                <div class="h5 text-green mb-3">Solutions</div>
                                                                                                    <div class="langdata1"><style>.fm-math,fmath{font-family:STIXGeneral,'DejaVu Serif','DejaVu                                 <li id="questionBox24" class="hideThis questLiClass">
                                    <div class="ques-no d-flex align-items-center p-3">
                                        <h6><strong>(24/51)</strong>  JEE Advanced 2023 Paper - 1</h6>
                                        <span>3 / -1</span>
                                    </div>
                                    <hr class="w-100 hr-gray mt-0">
                                    
                                    <div class="make-review bg-green mb-3 hideThis" id="questCorrectMarker473798">Q.24 Correct</div>

                                        <div class="px-3 mb-0 qsn-here"><style>.fm-math,fmath{font-family:STIXGeneral,'DejaVu Serif','DejaVu Sans',Times,OpenSymbol,'Standard Symbols menclose[notation=box],menclose.fm-menclose[notation=box]{border:thin solid}fmath none{display:none}</style><div class="questionText col-12 hscrollenable h5 p-3 mt-3" id="mquestion">
<span class="h5">In the given reaction scheme, <fmath class="fm-inline"><mi class="fm-mi-length-1 ma-bold ma-upright" mathvariant="bold">P</mi></fmath> is a phenyl alkyl ether, <fmath class="fm-inline"><mi class="fm-mi-length-1 ma-bold ma-upright" mathvariant="bold">Q</mi></fmath> is an aromatic compound; <fmath class="fm-inline"><mi class="fm-mi-length-1 ma-bold ma-upright" mathvariant="bold">R</mi></fmath> and <fmath class="fm-inline"><mi class="fm-mi-length-1 ma-bold ma-upright" mathvariant="bold">S</mi></fmath> are the major products. <br> <fmath <span class="h5">A gas has a compressibility factor of 0.5 and a molar volume of <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><mrow><mn>0.4</mn><msup><mi class="ma-repel-adj" mathvariant="normal">dm</mi><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: 0.7em;"><mn>3</mn></span></msup></mrow><msup><mi class="ma-repel-adj" mathvariant="normal">mol</mi><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: 0.7em;"><mrow><mo class="fm-prefix-tight">−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></span></msup></mrow></fmath> at a temperature of <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><mn>800</mn><mi class="fm-mi-length-1 ma-upright" mathvariant="normal" style="padding-right: 0px;">K</mi></mrow></fmath> and pressure <fmath class="fm-inline"><mi class="fm-mi-length-1 ma-bold ma-upright" mathvariant="bold">x</mi></fmath> atm. <div class="text-primary border-bottom p-2 mb-2 d-flex justify-content-between align-items-center">
<strong>Solution:</strong>
</div>
<div style="position: relative;z-index:1">

                                    <div class="ques-no d-flex align-items-center p-3">
                                        <h6><strong>(28/51)</strong>  JEE Advanced 2023 Paper - 1</h6>
                                        <span>4 / -0</span>
