<span class="h5">One mole of an ideal monoatomic gas undergoes two reversible processes <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow class="ma-repel-adj"><mo class="fm-mo-Luc fm-prefix">(</mo><mrow><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">A</mi><mo class="fm-infix-loose">→</mo><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">B</mi></mrow></mrow></fmath> and <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">B</mi><mo class="fm-infix-loose">→</mo><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">C</mi></mrow></fmath> ) as shown in the given figure:<br></span><img src="https://www.topcoaching.in/ckeditor/plugins/imageuploader/uploads/24_03_14_65f2a962ece30.png" data-filename="1.png" style="width: 309px;"><span class="h5"><br><div class="hscrollenable"><span class="sprite JEE_Adv_2023_P1_28"></span></div><fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">A</mi><mo class="fm-infix-loose">→</mo><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">B</mi></mrow></fmath> is an adiabatic process. If the total heat absorbed in the entire process <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow class="ma-repel-adj"><mo class="fm-mo-Luc fm-prefix">(</mo><mrow><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">A</mi><mo class="fm-infix-loose">→</mo><mrow><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">B</mi><mo class="fm-postfix-tight">.</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow></fmath> and <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">B</mi><mo class="fm-infix-loose">→</mo><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">C</mi></mrow></fmath> ) is <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow class="ma-repel-adj"><mrow class="ma-repel-adj"><mrow><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">R</mi><msub><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic" style="padding-right: 0.44ex;">T</mi><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: -0.5em;"><mn>2</mn></span></msub></mrow><mspace style="margin-right: 0.17em; padding-right: 0.001em; visibility: hidden;" width=".17em">&zwnj;</mspace><mi class="ma-repel-adj" mathvariant="normal">ln</mi></mrow><mspace style="margin-right: 0.17em; padding-right: 0.001em; visibility: hidden;" width=".17em">&zwnj;</mspace><mn>10</mn></mrow></fmath>, the value of <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow class="ma-repel-adj"><mrow class="ma-repel-adj"><mn>2</mn><mspace style="margin-right: 0.17em; padding-right: 0.001em; visibility: hidden;" width=".17em">&zwnj;</mspace><mi class="ma-repel-adj" mathvariant="normal">log</mi></mrow><mspace style="margin-right: 0.17em; padding-right: 0.001em; visibility: hidden;" width=".17em">&zwnj;</mspace><msub><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic" style="padding-right: 0.44ex;">V</mi><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: -0.5em;"><mn>3</mn></span></msub></mrow></fmath> is <br> [Use, molar heat capacity of the gas at constant pressure, <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><msub><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">C</mi><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: -0.5em;"><mrow><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">p</mi><mo class="fm-separator">,</mo><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">m</mi></mrow></span></msub><mo class="fm-infix-loose">=</mo><mrow><mspace style="margin-right: 0.28em; padding-right: 0.001em; visibility: hidden;" width=".28em">&zwnj;</mspace><mrow><span mtagname="mfrac" style="vertical-align: 0em;"><span class="fm-vert fm-frac"><table><tbody><tr><td class="fm-num-frac fm-inline"><mn>5</mn></td></tr><tr><td class="fm-den-frac fm-inline"><mn>2</mn></td></tr></tbody></table></span></span><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">R</mi></mrow></mrow></mrow></fmath> ]</span>
</div></div>

                                            <div class="solution-login-overlay position-absolute bg-white rounded-4 shadow-lg border-0 p-3 p-md-4 text-center" style="top: 0; left: 0; right: 0; z-index: 10; max-width: 500px; margin: 10px auto;">
                                                <p class="text-muted fs-6 mb-3 mb-md-4 lh-base px-2 px-md-0 fw-bold">
                                                    Verify mobile number to view the solution
                                                </p>

                                <li id="questionBox29" class="hideThis questLiClass">
                                    <div class="ques-no d-flex align-items-center p-3">
                                        <h6><strong>(29/51)</strong>  JEE Advanced 2023 Paper - 1</h6>
                                        <span>4 / -0</span>
                                    </div>
                                    <hr class="w-100 hr-gray mt-0">

<span class="h5">In a one-litre flask, 6 moles of <fmath class="fm-inline"><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">A</mi></fmath> undergoes the reaction <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><mrow><mi class="fm-mi-length-1 ma-upright" mathvariant="normal" style="padding-right: 0px;">A</mi><mrow><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">(</mo><mi class="fm-mi-length-1 ma-upright" mathvariant="normal" style="padding-right: 0px;">g</mi><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo class="fm-infix-loose">⇌</mo><mrow><mi class="fm-mi-length-1 ma-upright" mathvariant="normal" style="padding-right: 0px;">P</mi><mrow><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">(</mo><mi class="fm-mi-length-1 ma-upright" mathvariant="normal" style="padding-right: 0px;">g</mi><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow></fmath>. The progress of product formation at two temperatures (in Kelvin), <fmath class="fm-inline"><msub><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic" style="padding-right: 0.44ex;">T</mi><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: -0.5em;"><mn>1</mn></span></msub></fmath> and <fmath class="fm-inline"><msub><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic" style="padding-right: 0.44ex;">T</mi><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: -0.5em;"><mn>2</mn></span></msub></fmath>, is shown in the figure:<br></span><img src="https://www.topcoaching.in/ckeditor/plugins/imageuploader/uploads/24_03_14_65f2a9b524a10.png" data-filename="1.png" style="width: 386px;"><span class="h5"><br><div class="hscrollenable"><span class="sprite JEE_Adv_2023_P1_29"></span></div>If <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><msub><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic" style="padding-right: 0.44ex;">T</mi><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: -0.5em;"><mn>1</mn></span></msub><mo class="fm-infix-loose">=</mo><mrow><mn>2</mn><msub><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic" style="padding-right: 0.44ex;">T</mi><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: -0.5em;"><mn>2</mn></span></msub></mrow></mrow></fmath> and <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><mrow><mo class="fm-mo-Luc" style="font-size: 1.633em; vertical-align: -0.019em; display: inline-block; transform: scaleX(0.5);">(</mo><mrow><mrow><mo class="fm-prefix-tight">∆</mo><mrow><msubsup><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">G</mi><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: -0.5em;"><mn>2</mn></span><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: 0.81em;"><mo class="fm-large-op">⊖</mo></span></msubsup><mo class="fm-postfix-tight">−</mo></mrow></mrow><mo class="fm-infix-loose">∆</mo><msubsup><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">G</mi><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: -0.5em;"><mn>1</mn></span><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: 0.81em;"><mo class="fm-large-op">⊖</mo></span></msubsup></mrow><mo class="fm-mo-Luc" style="font-size: 1.633em; vertical-align: -0.019em; display: inline-block; transform: scaleX(0.5);">)</mo></mrow><mo class="fm-infix-loose">=</mo><mrow class="ma-repel-adj"><mrow class="ma-repel-adj"><mrow><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">R</mi><msub><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic" style="padding-right: 0.44ex;">T</mi><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: -0.5em;"><mn>2</mn></span></msub></mrow><mspace style="margin-right: 0.17em; padding-right: 0.001em; visibility: hidden;" width=".17em">&zwnj;</mspace><mi class="ma-repel-adj" mathvariant="normal">ln</mi></mrow><mspace style="margin-right: 0.17em; padding-right: 0.001em; visibility: hidden;" width=".17em">&zwnj;</mspace><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">x</mi></mrow></mrow></fmath>, then the value of <fmath class="fm-inline"><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">x</mi></fmath> is<br>[ <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><mo class="fm-prefix-tight">∆</mo><msubsup><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">G</mi><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: -0.5em;"><mn>1</mn></span><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: 0.81em;"><mo class="fm-large-op">⊖</mo></span></msubsup></mrow></fmath> and <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><mo class="fm-prefix-tight">∆</mo><msubsup><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">G</mi><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: -0.5em;"><mn>2</mn></span><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: 0.81em;"><mo class="fm-large-op">⊖</mo></span></msubsup></mrow></fmath> are standard Gibb's free energy change for the reaction at temperatures <fmath class="fm-inline"><msub><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic" style="padding-right: 0.44ex;">T</mi><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: -0.5em;"><mn>1</mn></span></msub></fmath> and <fmath class="fm-inline"><msub><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic" style="padding-right: 0.44ex;">T</mi><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: -0.5em;"><mn>2</mn></span></msub></fmath>, respectively.]</span>
</div></div>

<div class="text-primary border-bottom p-2 mb-2 d-flex justify-content-between align-items-center">
<strong>Solution:</strong>
</div>
<div style="position: relative;z-index:1">
<div class="hscrollenable">&emsp;&emsp;&emsp;&emsp;&emsp;&emsp;&emsp;&emsp;A(g)&emsp;⇌&emsp;P(g) <br> Intially&emsp;&emsp;&emsp;&emsp;&emsp;<fmath class="fm-inline"><mn>6</mn></fmath> &emsp;&emsp;&emsp;&emsp; <fmath class="fm-inline"><mn>0</mn></fmath> <br> At equilibrium&emsp;<fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><mrow><mspace style="margin-right: 0.28em; padding-right: 0.001em; visibility: hidden;" width=".28em">&zwnj;</mspace><mn>6</mn></mrow><mo class="fm-infix">−</mo><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">a</mi></mrow></fmath> &emsp;&emsp;<fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><mspace style="margin-right: 0.28em; padding-right: 0.001em; visibility: hidden;" width=".28em">&zwnj;</mspace><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">a</mi></mrow></fmath></div>at <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><mrow><mrow><msub><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic" style="padding-right: 0.44ex;">T</mi><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: -0.5em;"><mn>1</mn></span></msub><mspace style="margin-right: 0.28em; padding-right: 0.001em; visibility: hidden;" width=".28em">&zwnj;</mspace></mrow><mspace style="margin-right: 0.28em; padding-right: 0.001em; visibility: hidden;" width=".28em">&zwnj;</mspace><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">a</mi></mrow><mo class="fm-infix-loose">=</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></fmath>&emsp;&emsp;&emsp;&emsp;at <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><mrow><mrow><msub><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic" style="padding-right: 0.44ex;">T</mi><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: -0.5em;"><mn>2</mn></span></msub><mspace style="margin-right: 0.28em;                                     <div class="ques-no d-flex align-items-center p-3">
                                        <h6><strong>(32/51)</strong>  JEE Advanced 2023 Paper - 1</h6>

                                        <h6><strong>(33/51)</strong>  JEE Advanced 2023 Paper - 1</h6>

                                                <div class="h5 text-green mb-3">Solutions</div>

<div class="text-primary border-bottom p-2 mb-2 d-flex justify-content-between align-items-center">
<strong>Solution:</strong>
</div>
<div style="position: relative;z-index:1">   
                                    (P) Configuration at chiral carbon is same. <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><mi class="fm-mi-length-1 ma-upright" mathvariant="normal" style="padding-right: 0px;">P</mi><mo class="fm-infix-loose">→</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></fmath> [reaction does not occur at chiral carbon]<br>(Q) Configuration at chiral carbon changes.<br><fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><mi class="fm-mi-length-1 ma-upright" mathvariant="normal" style="padding-right: 0px;">Q</mi><mo class="fm-infix-loose">→</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></fmath><br>(R) <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><msub><mi class="fm-mi-length-1 ma-upright" mathvariant="normal" style="padding-right: 0px;">S</mi><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: -0.5em;"><mrow><mi class="fm-mi-length-1 ma-upright" mathvariant="normal" style="padding-right: 0px;">N</mi><mn>1</mn></mrow></span></msub><mo class="fm-postfix-tight">→</mo></mrow></fmath> Mixture of enantiomers formed.<br><fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><mi class="fm-mi-length-1 ma-upright" mathvariant="normal" style="padding-right: 0px;">R</mi><mo class="fm-infix-loose">→</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></fmath> <br> <div class="hscrollenable"><span class="sprite JEE_Adv_2023_P1_33_sol"></span></div> <img src="https://www.topcoaching.in/ckeditor/plugins/imageuploader/uploads/24_03_14_65f2ab3757a94.png" data-filename="2.png" style="width: 354px;"><fmath class="fm-inline"><mo><br>∴</mo></fmath> So mixture of diastereomers are formed.<br><fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><mi class="fm-mi-length-1 ma-upright" mathvariant="normal" style="padding-right: 0px;">S</mi><mo class="fm-infix-loose">→</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow></fmath>
</div>

</div></div>
                                                                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                                                    </li>
                                                                                            
                                <li id="questionBox34" class="hideThis questLiClass">
                                    <div class="ques-no d-flex align-items-center p-3">
                                        <h6><strong>(34/51)</strong>  JEE Advanced 2023 Paper - 1</h6>
                                        <span>3 / -1</span>
                                    </div>

                                                <div class="h5 text-green mb-3">Solutions</div>
                                                                                                    <div class="langdata1"><style>.fm-math,fmath{font-family:STIXGeneral,'DejaVu Serif','DejaVu Sans',Times,OpenSymbol,'Standard Symbols L',serif;line-height:1.2}.fm-math mtext,fmath mtext{line-height:normal}.fm-mo,.ma-sans-serif,fmath mi[mathvariant*=sans-serif],fmath mn[mathvariant*=sans-serif],fmath mo,fmath ms[mathvariant*=sans-serif],fmath mtext[mathvariant*=sans-serif]{font-family:STIXGeneral,'DejaVu Sans','DejaVu Serif','Arial Unicode MS','Lucida                                                 <div class="h5 text-green mb-3">Solutions</div>
                                                                                                    <div class="langdata1"><style>.fm-math,fmath{font-family:STIXGeneral,'DejaVu Serif','DejaVu L',sans-serif}.questionsfont{font-weight:200;font-family:Arial, sans-serif, STIXGeneral,'DejaVu Sans','DejaVu Serif','Lucida Grande','Arial Unicode MS',Times,OpenSymbol,'Standard Symbols L',sans-serif!important}</style><style>.fm-separator{padding:0 .56ex 0 0}.fm-infix-loose{padding:0 .56ex}.fm-infix{padding:0 .44ex}.fm-prefix{padding:0 .33ex 0 0}.fm-postfix{padding:0 0 0 .33ex}.fm-prefix-tight{padding:0 .11ex 0 0}.fm-postfix-tight{padding:0 0 0 .11ex}.fm-quantifier{padding:0 .11ex 0 .22ex}.ma-non-marking{display:none}.fm-vert,fmath menclose,menclose.fm-menclose{display:inline-block}.fm-large-op{font-size:1.3em}.fm-inline .fm-large-op{font-size:1em}fmath mrow{white-space:nowrap}.fm-vert{vertical-align:middle}fmath table,fmath tbody,fmath td,fmath tr{border:0!important;padding:0!important;margin:0!important;outline:0!important}fmath table{border-collapse:collapse!important;text-align:center!important;table-layout:auto!important;float:none!important}.fm-frac{padding:0 1px!important}td.fm-den-frac{border-top:solid thin!important}.fm-root{font-size:.6em}.fm-radicand{padding:0 1px 0 0;border-top:solid;margin-top:.1em}.fm-script{font-size:.71em}.fm-script .fm-script .fm-script{font-size:1em}td.fm-underover-base{line-height:1!important}td.fm-mtd{padding:.5ex .4em!important;vertical-align:baseline!important}fmath mphantom{visibility:hidden}fmath menclose[notation=top],menclose.fm-menclose[notation=top]{border-top:solid thin}fmath menclose[notation=right],menclose.fm-menclose[notation=right]{border-right:solid thin}fmath menclose[notation=bottom],menclose.fm-menclose[notation=bottom]{border-bottom:solid thin}fmath menclose[notation=left],menclose.fm-menclose[notation=left]{border-left:solid thin}fmath menclose[notation=box],menclose.fm-menclose[notation=box]{border:thin solid}fmath none{display:none}</style><div class="col-md-12 mb-2 text-left bg-white p-2 hscrollenable cardwithborders1 border-bottom border-danger questionsfont noselect" id="answerstatus">
<div class="text-primary border-bottom p-2 mb-2 d-flex justify-content-between align-items-center">
<strong>Solution:</strong>
</div>
<div style="position: relative;z-index:1">
<fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><mrow><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">S</mi><mo class="fm-infix-loose">=</mo><mrow><mrow><mrow><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">(</mo><mrow><mn>0</mn><mo class="fm-separator">,</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">)</mo></mrow><mo class="fm-infix">∪</mo><mrow><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">(</mo><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo class="fm-separator">,</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo class="fm-infix">∪</mo><mrow><mrow><mrow><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">(</mo><mrow><mn>3</mn><mo class="fm-separator">,</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">)</mo></mrow><mspace style="margin-right: 0.28em; padding-right: 0.001em; visibility: hidden;" width=".28em">&zwnj;</mspace><mtext> and </mtext></mrow><mspace style="margin-right: 0.28em; padding-right: 0.001em; visibility: hidden;" width=".28em">&zwnj;</mspace><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic" style="padding-right: 0.44ex;">T</mi></mrow></mrow></mrow><mo class="fm-infix-loose">=</mo><mrow><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">{</mo><mrow><mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn><mo class="fm-separator">,</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mo class="fm-separator">,</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow><mo class="fm-separator">,</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">}</mo></mrow></mrow></fmath><br>Let domain and co-domain of a function <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">y</mi><mo class="fm-infix-loose">=</mo><mrow><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic" style="padding-right: 0.44ex;">f</mi><mrow><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">(</mo><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">x</mi><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow></fmath> are <fmath class="fm-inline"><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">S</mi></fmath> and <fmath class="fm-inline"><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic" style="padding-right: 0.44ex;">T</mi></fmath> respectively.<br>(A) There are infinitely many elements in domain and four elements in co-domain.<br><fmath class="fm-inline"><mo>⇒</mo></fmath> There are infinitely many functions from <fmath class="fm-inline"><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">S</mi></fmath> to <fmath class="fm-inline"><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic" style="padding-right: 0.44ex;">T</mi></fmath>.<br><fmath class="fm-inline"><mo>⇒</mo></fmath> Option <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">(</mo><mi class="fm-mi-length-1 ma-upright" mathvariant="normal" style="padding-right: 0px;">A</mi><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">)</mo></mrow></fmath> is correct<br>(B) If number of elements in domain is greater than number of elements in co-domain, then number of strictly increasing function is zero.<br><fmath class="fm-inline"><mo>⇒</mo></fmath> Option <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">(</mo><mi class="fm-mi-length-1 ma-upright" mathvariant="normal" style="padding-right: 0px;">B</mi><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">)</mo></mrow></fmath> is incorrect<br>(C) Maximum number of continuous functions <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><mrow><mo class="fm-infix-loose">=</mo><mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn><mo class="fm-infix" lspace=".22em" rspace=".22em">×</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow><mo class="fm-infix" lspace=".22em" rspace=".22em">×</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></mrow><mo class="fm-infix-loose">=</mo><mn>64</mn></mrow></fmath><br>(Every subset <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><mrow><mrow><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">(</mo><mrow><mn>0</mn><mo class="fm-separator">,</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">)</mo></mrow><mo class="fm-separator">,</mo><mrow><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">(</mo><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo class="fm-separator">,</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo class="fm-separator">,</mo><mrow><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">(</mo><mrow><mn>3</mn><mo class="fm-separator">,</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">)</mo></mrow></mrow></fmath> has four choices)<br><fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><mo class="fm-prefix-tight">∵</mo><mrow><mrow><mspace style="margin-right: 0.28em; padding-right: 0.001em; visibility: hidden;" width=".28em">&zwnj;</mspace><mspace style="margin-right: 0.28em; padding-right: 0.001em; visibility: hidden;" width=".28em">&zwnj;</mspace><mn>64</mn></mrow><mo class="fm-infix-loose">&lt;</mo><mrow><mn>120</mn><mo class="fm-postfix-tight">⇒</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow></fmath> option <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">(</mo><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">C</mi><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">)</mo></mrow></fmath> is correct.<br>(D) For every point at which <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic" style="padding-right: 0.44ex;">f</mi><mrow><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">(</mo><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">x</mi><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">)</mo></mrow></mrow></fmath> is continuous, <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><mrow><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic" style="padding-right: 0.44ex;">f</mi><mrow><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">(</mo><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">x</mi><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo class="fm-infix-loose">=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></fmath><br><fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><mo class="fm-prefix-tight">⇒</mo><mrow><mspace style="margin-right: 0.28em; padding-right: 0.001em; visibility: hidden;" width=".28em">&zwnj;</mspace><mspace style="margin-right: 0.28em; padding-right: 0.001em; visibility: hidden;" width=".28em">&zwnj;</mspace></mrow></mrow></fmath> Every continuous function from <fmath class="fm-inline"><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">S</mi></fmath> to <fmath class="fm-inline"><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic" style="padding-right: 0.44ex;">T</mi></fmath> is differentiable. 
                            </div>

</div></div>
                                                                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                                                    </li>

                                        <h6><strong>(36/51)</strong>  JEE Advanced 2023 Paper - 1</h6>
                                        <span>4 / -2</span>

<span class="h5">Let <fmath class="fm-inline"><msub><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic" style="padding-right: 0.44ex;">T</mi><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: -0.5em;"><mn>1</mn></span></msub></fmath> and <fmath class="fm-inline"><msub><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic" style="padding-right: 0.44ex;">T</mi><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: -0.5em;"><mn>2</mn></span></msub></fmath> be two distinct common tangents to the ellipse <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic" style="padding-right: 0.44ex;">E</mi><mo class="fm-infix-loose">:</mo><mrow><mrow><mrow><mspace style="margin-right: 0.28em; padding-right: 0.001em; visibility: hidden;" width=".28em">&zwnj;</mspace><span mtagname="mfrac" style="vertical-align: 0.126em;"><span class="fm-vert fm-frac"><table><tbody><tr><td class="fm-num-frac fm-inline"><msup><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">x</mi><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: 0.7em;"><mn>2</mn></span></msup></td></tr><tr><td class="fm-den-frac fm-inline"><mn>6</mn></td></tr></tbody></table></span></span></mrow><mo class="fm-infix">+</mo><mrow><mspace style="margin-right: 0.28em; padding-right: 0.001em; visibility: hidden;" width=".28em">&zwnj;</mspace><span mtagname="mfrac" style="vertical-align: 0.126em;"><span class="fm-vert fm-frac"><table><tbody><tr><td class="fm-num-frac fm-inline"><msup><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">y</mi><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: 0.7em;"><mn>2</mn></span></msup></td></tr><tr><td class="fm-den-frac fm-inline"><mn>3</mn></td></tr></tbody></table></span></span></mrow></mrow><mo class="fm-infix-loose">=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mrow></fmath> and the parabola <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">P</mi><mo class="fm-infix-loose">:</mo><mrow><msup><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">y</mi><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: 0.7em;"><mn>2</mn></span></msup><mo class="fm-infix-loose">=</mo><mrow><mn>12</mn><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">x</mi></mrow></mrow></mrow></fmath>.<br>Suppose that the tangent <fmath class="fm-inline"><msub><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic" style="padding-right: 0.44ex;">T</mi><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: -0.5em;"><mn>1</mn></span></msub></fmath> touches <fmath class="fm-inline"><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">P</mi></fmath> and <fmath class="fm-inline"><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic" style="padding-right: 0.44ex;">E</mi></fmath> at the points <fmath class="fm-inline"><msub><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">A</mi><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: -0.5em;"><mn>1</mn></span></msub></fmath> and <fmath class="fm-inline"><msub><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">A</mi><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: -0.5em;"><mn>2</mn></span></msub></fmath>, respectively and the tangent <fmath class="fm-inline"><msub><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic" style="padding-right: 0.44ex;">T</mi><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: -0.5em;"><mn>2</mn></span></msub></fmath> touches <fmath class="fm-inline"><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">P</mi></fmath> and <fmath class="fm-inline"><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic" style="padding-right: 0.44ex;">E</mi></fmath> at the points <fmath class="fm-inline"><msub><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">A</mi><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: -0.5em;"><mn>4</mn></span></msub></fmath> and <fmath class="fm-inline"><msub><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">A</mi><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: -0.5em;"><mn>3</mn></span></msub></fmath>, respectively. Then which of the following statements is(are) true?<br></span>
</div></div>

                                                                                                                            <h6 class="langdata1"><style>.fm-math,fmath{font-family:STIXGeneral,'DejaVu menclose[notation=top],menclose.fm-menclose[notation=top]{border-top:solid thin}fmath menclose[notation=right],menclose.fm-menclose[notation=right]{border-right:solid thin}fmath menclose[notation=box],menclose.fm-menclose[notation=box]{border:thin solid}fmath none{display:none}</style><span> The area of the quadrilateral <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><mrow><mrow><msub><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">A</mi><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: -0.5em;"><mn>1</mn></span></msub><msub><mi class="fm-mi-length-1"                                                     </div>
                                                </div>

class="fm-postfix-tight">⇒</mo></mrow></fmath> tangent to <fmath class="fm-inline"><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic" style="padding-right: 0.44ex;">E</mi></fmath> is <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><mrow><mrow><mspace style="margin-right: 0.28em; padding-right: 0.001em; visibility: hidden;" width=".28em">&zwnj;</mspace><span mtagname="mfrac" style="vertical-align: 0.126em;"><span class="fm-vert fm-frac"><table><tbody><tr><td class="fm-num-frac fm-inline"><mrow><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">x</mi><msub><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" class="fm-prefix-tight">⇒</mo><mrow><msub><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">A</mi><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: -0.5em;"><mn>3</mn></span></msub><mrow><mo data-filename="1.png" style="width: 435px;"></div>Intersection point of <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><msub><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic" style="padding-right: 0.44ex;">T</mi><span class="fm-separator">,</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">)</mo></mrow></fmath><br>Area of quadrilateral <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><mrow><mrow><mrow><mrow><msub><mi class="fm-mi-length-1"                             </div>

</div></div>

<span class="h5">Let <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic" style="padding-right: 0.44ex;">f</mi><mo class="fm-infix-loose">:</mo><mrow><mrow><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">[</mo><mrow><mn>0</mn><mo class="fm-separator">,</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">]</mo></mrow><mo class="fm-infix-loose">→</mo><mrow><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">[</mo><mrow><mn>0</mn><mo class="fm-separator">,</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">]</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow></fmath> be the function defined by <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><mrow><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic" style="padding-right: 0.44ex;">f</mi><mrow><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">(</mo><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">x</mi><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo class="fm-infix-loose">=</mo><mrow><mrow><mrow><mrow><mspace style="margin-right: 0.28em; Consider the square region <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">S</mi><mo class="fm-infix-loose">=</mo><mrow><mrow><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">[</mo><mrow><mn>0</mn><mo class="fm-separator">,</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">]</mo></mrow><mo class="fm-infix" lspace=".22em" rspace=".22em">×</mo><mrow><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">[</mo><mrow><mn>0</mn><mo class="fm-separator">,</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">]</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow></fmath>. Let <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">G</mi><mo class="fm-infix-loose">=</mo><mrow><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">{</mo><mrow><mrow><mrow><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">(</mo><mrow><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">x</mi><mo class="fm-separator">,</mo><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">y</mi></mrow><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">)</mo></mrow><mo class="fm-infix-loose">∈</mo><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">S</mi></mrow><mo class="fm-infix-loose">:</mo><mrow><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">y</mi><mo class="fm-infix-loose">&gt;</mo><mrow><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic" style="padding-right: 0.44ex;">f</mi><mrow><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">(</mo><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">x</mi><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow></mrow><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">}</mo></mrow></mrow></fmath> be called the green region and <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">R</mi><mo class="fm-infix-loose">=</mo><mrow><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">{</mo><mrow><mrow><mrow><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">(</mo><mrow><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">x</mi><mo class="fm-separator">,</mo><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">y</mi></mrow><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">)</mo></mrow><mo class="fm-infix-loose">∈</mo><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">S</mi></mrow><mo class="fm-infix-loose">:</mo><mrow><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">y</mi><mo class="fm-infix-loose">&lt;</mo><mrow><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic" style="padding-right: 0.44ex;">f</mi><mrow><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">(</mo><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">x</mi><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow></mrow><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">}</mo></mrow></mrow></fmath> be called the red region. Let <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><msub><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">L</mi><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: -0.5em;"><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">h</mi></span></msub><mo class="fm-infix-loose">=</mo><mrow><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">{</mo><mrow><mrow><mrow><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">(</mo><mrow><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">x</mi><mo class="fm-separator">,</mo><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">h</mi></mrow><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">)</mo></mrow><mo class="fm-infix-loose">∈</mo><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">S</mi></mrow><mo class="fm-infix-loose">:</mo><mrow><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">x</mi><mo class="fm-infix-loose">∈</mo><mrow><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">[</mo><mrow><mn>0</mn><mo class="fm-separator">,</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">]</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">}</mo></mrow></mrow></fmath> be the horizontal line drawn at a height <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">h</mi><mo class="fm-infix-loose">∈</mo><mrow><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">[</mo><mrow><mn>0</mn><mo class="fm-separator">,</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">]</mo></mrow></mrow></fmath>. Then which of the following statements is(are) true?<br></span>

<strong>Solution:</strong></div><div class="text-primary border-bottom p-2 mb-2 d-flex justify-content-between align-items-center"><img src="https://www.topcoaching.in/ckeditor/plugins/imageuploader/uploads/24_03_14_65f2ac4491b7a.png" data-filename="1.png" style="width: 289px;"><strong><br></strong>

padding-right: 0.001em; visibility: hidden;" width=".28em">&zwnj;</mspace><span mtagname="mfrac" style="vertical-align: 0em;"><span class="fm-vert fm-frac"><table><tbody><tr><td class="fm-num-frac fm-inline"><mn>1</mn></td></tr><tr><td class="fm-den-frac fm-inline"><mn>3</mn></td></tr></tbody></table></span></span></mrow></mrow></fmath><br><fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><mrow><mrow><msub><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">A</mi><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: -0.5em;"><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">R</mi></span></msub><mo class="fm-infix-loose">=</mo><mrow class="ma-repel-adj"><span class="fm-prefix" mtagname="munderover" style="vertical-align: 0.064em;"><span class="fm-vert"><table><tbody><tr><td class="fm-script fm-inline"><mn>1</mn></td></tr><tr><td class="fm-underover-base"><mo class="fm-large-op">∫</mo></td></tr><tr><td class="fm-script fm-inline"><mn>0</mn></td></tr></tbody></table></span></span><mrow class="ma-repel-adj"><mrow><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic" style="padding-right: 0.44ex;">f</mi><mrow><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">(</mo><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">x</mi><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mspace style="margin-right: 0.17em;                             </div>

<span class="h5">Let <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic" style="padding-right: 0.44ex;">f</mi><mo class="fm-infix-loose">:</mo><mrow><mrow><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">(</mo><mrow><mn>0</mn><mo class="fm-separator">,</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">)</mo></mrow><mo class="fm-infix-loose">→</mo><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">ℝ</mi></mrow></mrow></fmath> be the function defined as <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><mrow><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic" style="padding-right: 0.44ex;">f</mi><mrow><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">(</mo><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">x</mi><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo class="fm-infix-loose">=</mo><mrow mtagname="msqrt"><mo class="fm-radic">√</mo><span style="vertical-align: 0.086em;"><span class="fm-vert fm-radicand" style="border-top-width: 0.072em;"><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">n</mi></span></span></mrow></mrow></fmath> if <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">x</mi><mo class="fm-infix-loose">∈</mo><mrow><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">[</mo><mrow><mrow><mrow><mspace style="margin-right: 0.28em; padding-right: 0.001em; visibility: hidden;" width=".28em">&zwnj;</mspace><mn>1</mn></mrow><mo class="fm-infix-loose">∕</mo><mrow><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">n</mi><mo class="fm-infix">+</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mrow><mo class="fm-separator">,</mo><mrow><mrow><mspace style="margin-right: 0.28em; padding-right: 0.001em; visibility: hidden;" width=".28em">&zwnj;</mspace><mn>1</mn></mrow><mo class="fm-infix-loose">∕</mo><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">n</mi></mrow></mrow><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">)</mo></mrow></mrow></fmath> where <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">n</mi><mo class="fm-infix-loose">∈</mo><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">ℕ</mi></mrow></fmath>. Let <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">g</mi><mo class="fm-infix-loose">:</mo><mrow><mrow><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">(</mo><mrow><mn>0</mn><mo class="fm-separator">,</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">)</mo></mrow><mo class="fm-infix-loose">→</mo><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">ℝ</mi></mrow></mrow></fmath> be a function such that <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><mrow><mrow class="ma-repel-adj"><span class="fm-prefix" mtagname="munder" style="vertical-align: -0.512em;"><span class="fm-vert"><table><tbody><tr><td class="fm-underover-base"><mo class="fm-large-op">∫</mo></td></tr><tr><td class="fm-script fm-inline"><msup><span mtagname="mover" style="vertical-align: 0.301em;"><span class="fm-vert"><table><tbody><tr><td class="fm-script fm-inline"><mn>2</mn></td></tr><tr><td class="fm-underover-base"><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic" style="display: block; margin-top: -0.25em;">x</mi></td></tr></tbody></table></span></span><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: 1.07em;"><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">x</mi></span></msup></td></tr></tbody></table></span></span><mrow class="ma-repel-adj"><mrow mtagname="msqrt"><mo class="fm-radic">√</mo><span style="vertical-align: 0.086em;"><span class="fm-vert fm-radicand" style="border-top-width: 0.072em;"><mrow><mrow><mspace style="margin-right: 0.28em; padding-right: 0.001em; visibility: hidden;" width=".28em">&zwnj;</mspace><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo class="fm-infix">−</mo><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">t</mi></mrow></mrow><mo class="fm-infix-loose">∕</mo><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">t</mi></mrow></span></span></mrow><mspace style="margin-right: 0.17em; padding-right: 0.001em; visibility: hidden;" width=".17em">&zwnj;</mspace><mi class="ma-repel-adj" mathvariant="normal">dt</mi></mrow></mrow><mo class="fm-infix-loose">&lt;</mo><mrow><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">g</mi><mrow><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">(</mo><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">x</mi><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow><mo class="fm-infix-loose">&lt;</mo><mrow><mn>2</mn><mrow mtagname="msqrt"><mo class="fm-radic">√</mo><span style="vertical-align: 0.086em;"><span class="fm-vert fm-radicand" style="border-top-width: 0.072em;"><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">x</mi></span></span></mrow></mrow></mrow></fmath> for all <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">x</mi><mo class="fm-infix-loose">∈</mo><mrow><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">(</mo><mrow><mn>0</mn><mo class="fm-separator">,</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">)</mo></mrow></mrow></fmath>. Then <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><mrow><mrow><mrow><span mtagname="munder" style="vertical-align: -0.426em;"><span class="fm-vert"><table><tbody><tr><td class="fm-underover-base"><mi class="ma-repel-adj" mathvariant="normal">lim</mi></td></tr><tr><td class="fm-script fm-inline"><mrow><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">x</mi><mo class="fm-infix-loose">→</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></td></tr></tbody></table></span></span><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic" style="padding-right: 0.44ex;">f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">(</mo><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">x</mi><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">g</mi></mrow><mrow><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">(</mo><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">x</mi><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">)</mo></mrow></mrow></fmath><br></span>
</div></div>
                                    
                                    
                                    <form class="p-3">

                                                        <label class="form-check-label d-flex align-items-center" for="radioOption1473812">
                                                            <span class="optionIndex">A</span>

                                                                                                                            <h6 class="langdata1"><style>.fm-math,fmath{font-family:STIXGeneral,'DejaVu Serif','DejaVu Sans',Times,OpenSymbol,'Standard Symbols L',serif;line-height:1.2}.fm-math mtext,fmath mtext{line-height:normal}.fm-mo,.ma-sans-serif,fmath mi[mathvariant*=sans-serif],fmath mn[mathvariant*=sans-serif],fmath mo,fmath ms[mathvariant*=sans-serif],fmath mtext[mathvariant*=sans-serif]{font-family:STIXGeneral,'DejaVu Sans','DejaVu Serif','Arial Unicode MS','Lucida Grande',Times,OpenSymbol,'Standard Symbols L',sans-serif}.fm-mo-Luc{font-family:STIXGeneral,'DejaVu Sans','DejaVu Serif','Lucida Grande','Arial Unicode MS',Times,OpenSymbol,'Standard Symbols L',sans-serif}.questionsfont{font-weight:200;font-family:Arial, sans-serif, STIXGeneral,'DejaVu Sans','DejaVu Serif','Lucida Grande','Arial Unicode MS',Times,OpenSymbol,'Standard Symbols L',sans-serif!important}</style><style>.fm-separator{padding:0 .56ex 0 0}.fm-infix-loose{padding:0 .56ex}.fm-infix{padding:0 .44ex}.fm-prefix{padding:0 .33ex 0 0}.fm-postfix{padding:0 0 0 <div class="text-primary border-bottom p-2 mb-2 d-flex justify-content-between align-items-center">
<strong>Solution:</strong>
</div>
<div style="position: relative;z-index:1">

0.44ex;">Z</mi></mrow></fmath> is equal to 2 . 
                            </div>

                                <li id="questionBox39" class="hideThis questLiClass">
                                    <div class="ques-no d-flex align-items-center p-3">
                                        <h6><strong>(39/51)</strong>  JEE Advanced 2023 Paper - 1</h6>
                                        <span>3 / -1</span>

.fm-script{font-size:1em}td.fm-underover-base{line-height:1!important}td.fm-mtd{padding:.5ex .4em!important;vertical-align:baseline!important}fmath mphantom{visibility:hidden}fmath <span class="h5">Let <fmath class="fm-inline"><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">Q</mi></fmath> be the cube with the set of vertices <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">{</mo><mrow><mrow><mrow><mrow><mrow><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">(</mo><mrow><mrow><msub><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">x</mi><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: -0.5em;"><mn>1</mn></span></msub><mo class="fm-separator">,</mo><msub><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">x</mi><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: -0.5em;"><mn>2</mn></span></msub></mrow><mo class="fm-separator">,</mo><msub><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">x</mi><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: -0.5em;"><mn>3</mn></span></msub></mrow><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">)</mo></mrow><mo class="fm-infix-loose">∈</mo><msup><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">ℝ</mi><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: 0.7em;"><mn>3</mn></span></msup></mrow><mo class="fm-infix-loose">:</mo><msub><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">x</mi><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: -0.5em;"><mn>1</mn></span></msub></mrow><mo class="fm-separator">,</mo><msub><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">x</mi><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: -0.5em;"><mn>2</mn></span></msub></mrow><mo class="fm-separator">,</mo><mrow><msub><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">x</mi><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: -0.5em;"><mn>3</mn></span></msub><mo class="fm-infix-loose">∈</mo><mrow><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">{</mo><mrow><mn>0</mn><mo class="fm-separator">,</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">}</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">}</mo></mrow></fmath>. Let <fmath class="fm-inline"><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic" style="padding-right: 0.44ex;">F</mi></fmath> be the set of all twelve lines containing the diagonals of the six faces of the cube <fmath class="fm-inline"><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">Q</mi></fmath>. Let <fmath class="fm-inline"><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">S</mi></fmath> be the set of all four lines containing the main diagonals of the cube <fmath class="fm-inline"><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">Q</mi></fmath>; for instance, the line passing through the vertices <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">(</mo><mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn><mo class="fm-separator">,</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow><mo class="fm-separator">,</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">)</mo></mrow></fmath> and <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">(</mo><mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo class="fm-separator">,</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mo class="fm-separator">,</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">)</mo></mrow></fmath> is in <fmath class="fm-inline"><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">S</mi></fmath>. For lines <fmath class="fm-inline"><msub><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">ℓ</mi><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: -0.5em;"><mn>1</mn></span></msub></fmath> and <fmath class="fm-inline"><msub><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">ℓ</mi><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: -0.5em;"><mn>2</mn></span></msub></fmath>, let <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic" style="padding-right: 0.44ex;">d</mi><mrow><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">(</mo><mrow><msub><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">ℓ</mi><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: -0.5em;"><mn>1</mn></span></msub><mo class="fm-separator">,</mo><msub><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">ℓ</mi><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: -0.5em;"><mn>2</mn></span></msub></mrow><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">)</mo></mrow></mrow></fmath> denote the shortest distance between them. Then the maximum value of <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic" style="padding-right: 0.44ex;">d</mi><mrow><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">(</mo><mrow><msub><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">ℓ</mi><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: -0.5em;"><mn>1</mn></span></msub><mo class="fm-separator">,</mo><msub><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">ℓ</mi><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: -0.5em;"><mn>2</mn></span></msub></mrow><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">)</mo></mrow></mrow></fmath>, as <fmath class="fm-inline"><msub><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">ℓ</mi><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: -0.5em;"><mn>1</mn></span></msub></fmath> varies over <fmath class="fm-inline"><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic" style="padding-right: 0.44ex;">F</mi></fmath> and <fmath class="fm-inline"><msub><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">ℓ</mi><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: -0.5em;"><mn>2</mn></span></msub></fmath> varies over <fmath class="fm-inline"><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">S</mi></fmath>, is<br></span>
</div></div>

                                                            <span class="optionIndex">C</span>

                                                                                                                            <h6 class="langdata1"><style>.fm-math,fmath{font-family:STIXGeneral,'DejaVu                                         <h6><strong>(40/51)</strong>  JEE Advanced 2023 Paper - 1</h6>

menclose[notation=bottom],menclose.fm-menclose[notation=bottom]{border-bottom:solid thin}fmath menclose[notation=left],menclose.fm-menclose[notation=left]{border-left:solid thin}fmath menclose[notation=box],menclose.fm-menclose[notation=box]{border:thin solid}fmath none{display:none}</style><div class="questionText col-12 hscrollenable h5 p-3 mt-3" id="mquestion">
<span class="h5">Let <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic" style="padding-right: 0.44ex;">X</mi><mo class="fm-infix-loose">=</mo><mrow class="ma-repel-adj"><mo class="fm-mo-Luc" style="font-size: 2.26em; vertical-align: -0.084em; display: inline-block; transform: scaleX(0.5);">{</mo><mrow><mrow><mrow><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">(</mo><mrow><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">x</mi><mo class="fm-separator">,</mo><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">y</mi></mrow><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">)</mo></mrow><mo class="fm-infix-loose">∈</mo><mrow><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">ℤ</mi><mo class="fm-infix" lspace=".22em" rspace=".22em">×</mo><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">ℤ</mi></mrow></mrow><mo class="fm-infix-loose">:</mo><mrow><mrow><mrow><mspace style="margin-right: 0.28em; padding-right: 0.001em; visibility: hidden;" width=".28em">&zwnj;</mspace><span mtagname="mfrac" style="vertical-align: 0.126em;"><span class="fm-vert fm-frac"><table><tbody><tr><td class="fm-num-frac fm-inline"><msup><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">x</mi><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: 0.7em;"><mn>2</mn></span></msup></td></tr><tr><td class="fm-den-frac fm-inline"><mn>8</mn></td></tr></tbody></table></span></span></mrow><mo class="fm-infix">+</mo><mrow><mspace style="margin-right: 0.28em; padding-right: 0.001em; visibility: hidden;" width=".28em">&zwnj;</mspace><span mtagname="mfrac" style="vertical-align: 0.126em;"><span class="fm-vert fm-frac"><table><tbody><tr><td class="fm-num-frac fm-inline"><msup><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">y</mi><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: 0.7em;"><mn>2</mn></span></msup></td></tr><tr><td class="fm-den-frac fm-inline"><mn>20</mn></td></tr></tbody></table></span></span></mrow></mrow><mo class="fm-infix-loose">&lt;</mo><mn>1.</mn></mrow></mrow></mrow></mrow></fmath> and <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow class="ma-repel-adj"><mrow><msup><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">y</mi><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: 0.7em;"><mn>2</mn></span></msup><mo class="fm-infix-loose">&lt;</mo><mrow><mn>5</mn><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">x</mi></mrow></mrow><mo class="fm-mo-Luc fm-postfix">}</mo></mrow></fmath>. Three distinct point <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">P</mi><mo class="fm-separator">,</mo><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">Q</mi></mrow></fmath> and <fmath class="fm-inline"><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">R</mi></fmath> are randomly chosen from <fmath class="fm-inline"><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic" style="padding-right: 0.44ex;">X</mi></fmath>. Then the probability that <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">P</mi><mo class="fm-separator">,</mo><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">Q</mi></mrow></fmath> and <fmath class="fm-inline"><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">R</mi></fmath> form a triangle whose area is a positive integer, is<br></span>
</div></div>

                                                            <span class="optionIndex">A</span>

                                                <div class="h5 text-green mb-3">Solutions</div>
                                                                                                    <div class="langdata1"><style>.fm-math,fmath{font-family:STIXGeneral,'DejaVu Serif','DejaVu menclose[notation=top],menclose.fm-menclose[notation=top]{border-top:solid thin}fmath menclose[notation=right],menclose.fm-menclose[notation=right]{border-right:solid thin}fmath menclose[notation=box],menclose.fm-menclose[notation=box]{border:thin solid}fmath none{display:none}</style><div class="col-md-12 mb-2 text-left bg-white p-2 hscrollenable cardwithborders1 border-bottom border-danger questionsfont noselect" id="answerstatus">
<div class="text-primary border-bottom p-2 mb-2 d-flex justify-content-between align-items-center">
<strong>Solution:</strong>
</div>
<div style="position: relative;z-index:1">   
                                    The given region are as<br><img src="https://www.topcoaching.in/ckeditor/plugins/imageuploader/uploads/24_03_14_65f2acb9d2156.png" data-filename="1.png" style="width: 424px;"><br><div class="hscrollenable"><span class="sprite JEE_Adv_2023_P1_40_sol"></span></div>The points inside region are <div class="hscrollenable"><fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow class="ma-repel-adj"><mo class="fm-mo-Luc fm-prefix">{</mo><mrow><mrow><mrow><mrow><mrow><mrow><mrow><mrow><mrow><mrow><mrow><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">(</mo><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo class="fm-separator">,</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">)</mo></mrow><mo class="fm-separator">,</mo><mrow><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">(</mo><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo class="fm-separator">,</mo><mrow><mo class="fm-prefix-tight">−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mrow><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo class="fm-separator">,</mo><mrow><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">(</mo><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo class="fm-separator">,</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo class="fm-separator">,</mo><mrow><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">(</mo><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo class="fm-separator">,</mo><mrow><mo class="fm-prefix-tight">−</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mrow><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo class="fm-separator">,</mo><mrow><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">(</mo><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo class="fm-separator">,</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo class="fm-separator">,</mo><mrow><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">(</mo><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo class="fm-separator">,</mo><mrow><mo class="fm-prefix-tight">−</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mrow><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo class="fm-separator">,</mo><mrow><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">(</mo><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo class="fm-separator">,</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo class="fm-separator">,</mo><mrow><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">(</mo><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo class="fm-separator">,</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo class="fm-separator">,</mo><mrow><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">(</mo><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo class="fm-separator">,</mo><mrow><mo class="fm-prefix-tight">−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mrow><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo class="fm-separator">,</mo><mrow><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">(</mo><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo class="fm-separator">,</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo class="fm-separator">,</mo><mrow><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">(</mo><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo class="fm-separator">,</mo><mrow><mo class="fm-prefix-tight">−</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mrow><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow></fmath>, <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow class="ma-repel-adj"><mrow><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">(</mo><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo class="fm-separator">,</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">)</mo></mrow><mo class="fm-mo-Luc fm-postfix">}</mo></mrow></fmath>.<br></div>Total number of ways to select three points <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><mrow><mo class="fm-infix-loose">=</mo><mrow><msup><mspace style="margin-right: 0px; padding-right: 0.001em; visibility: hidden;">&zwnj;</mspace><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: 0.7em;"><mn>12</mn></span></msup><msub><mi class="fm-mi-length-1 ma-upright" mathvariant="normal" style="padding-right: 0px;">C</mi><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: -0.5em;"><mn>3</mn></span></msub></mrow></mrow><mo class="fm-infix-loose">=</mo><mn>220</mn></mrow></fmath><br>Required number of triangle <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><mrow><mo class="fm-infix-loose">=</mo><mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn><mo class="fm-infix" lspace=".22em" rspace=".22em">×</mo><mrow><msup><mspace style="margin-right: 0px; padding-right: 0.001em; visibility: hidden;">&zwnj;</mspace><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: 0.7em;"><mn>7</mn></span></msup><msub><mi class="fm-mi-length-1 ma-upright" mathvariant="normal" style="padding-right: 0px;">C</mi><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: -0.5em;"><mn>1</mn></span></msub></mrow></mrow><mo class="fm-infix">+</mo><mrow><mn>9</mn><mo class="fm-infix" lspace=".22em" rspace=".22em">×</mo><mrow><msup><mspace style="margin-right: 0px; padding-right: 0.001em; visibility: hidden;">&zwnj;</mspace><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: 0.7em;"><mn>5</mn></span></msup><msub><mi class="fm-mi-length-1 ma-upright" mathvariant="normal" style="padding-right: 0px;">C</mi><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: -0.5em;"><mn>1</mn></span></msub></mrow></mrow></mrow></mrow><mo class="fm-infix-loose">=</mo><mn>73</mn></mrow></fmath><br>Points are taken such a way that distance between two points are multiple of 2 . 
                            </div>

</div></div>

                                        </div>

                                <li id="questionBox41" class="hideThis questLiClass">

                                        <h6><strong>(41/51)</strong>  JEE Advanced 2023 Paper - 1</h6>

<span class="h5">Let <fmath class="fm-inline"><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">P</mi></fmath> be a point on the parabola <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><msup><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">y</mi><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: 0.7em;"><mn>2</mn></span></msup><mo class="fm-infix-loose">=</mo><mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">a</mi></mrow><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">x</mi></mrow></mrow></fmath>, where <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">a</mi><mo class="fm-infix-loose">&gt;</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></fmath>. The normal to the parabola at <fmath class="fm-inline"><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">P</mi></fmath> meets the <fmath class="fm-inline"><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">x</mi></fmath>-axis at a point <fmath class="fm-inline"><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">Q</mi></fmath>. The area of the triangle <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><mrow><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">P</mi><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic" style="padding-right: 0.44ex;">F</mi></mrow><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">Q</mi></mrow></fmath>, where <fmath class="fm-inline"><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic" style="padding-right: 0.44ex;">F</mi></fmath> is the focus of the parabola, is 120 . If the slope <fmath class="fm-inline"><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">m</mi></fmath> of the normal and <fmath class="fm-inline"><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">a</mi></fmath> are both positive integers, then the pair <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">(</mo><mrow><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">a</mi><mo class="fm-separator">,</mo><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">m</mi></mrow><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">)</mo></mrow></fmath> is<br></span>

<span class="h5">Let <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><mrow><msup><mi class="ma-repel-adj" mathvariant="normal">tan</mi><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: 0.7em;"><mrow><mo class="fm-prefix-tight">−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></span></msup><mrow><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">(</mo><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">x</mi><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo class="fm-infix-loose">∈</mo><mrow><mo class="fm-mo-Luc" style="font-size: 2.05em; vertical-align: -0.128em; display: inline-block; transform: scaleX(0.5);">(</mo><mrow><mrow><mo class="fm-prefix-tight">−</mo><mrow><mspace style="margin-right: 0.28em; padding-right: 0.001em; visibility: hidden;" width=".28em">&zwnj;</mspace><span mtagname="mfrac" style="vertical-align: 0em;"><span class="fm-vert fm-frac"><table><tbody><tr><td class="fm-num-frac fm-inline"><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">π</mi></td></tr><tr><td class="fm-den-frac fm-inline"><mn>2</mn></td></tr></tbody></table></span></span></mrow></mrow><mo class="fm-separator">,</mo><mrow><mspace style="margin-right: 0.28em; padding-right: 0.001em; visibility: hidden;" width=".28em">&zwnj;</mspace><span mtagname="mfrac" style="vertical-align: 0em;"><span class="fm-vert fm-frac"><table><tbody><tr><td class="fm-num-frac fm-inline"><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">π</mi></td></tr><tr><td class="fm-den-frac fm-inline"><mn>2</mn></td></tr></tbody></table></span></span></mrow></mrow><mo class="fm-mo-Luc" style="font-size: 2.05em; vertical-align: -0.128em; display: inline-block; transform: scaleX(0.5);">)</mo></mrow></mrow></fmath>, for <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">x</mi><mo class="fm-infix-loose">∈</mo><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">ℝ</mi></mrow></fmath>. Then the number of real solutions of the equation <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><mrow mtagname="msqrt"><mo class="fm-radic">√</mo><span style="vertical-align: 0.086em;"><span class="fm-vert fm-radicand" style="border-top-width: 0.072em;"><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo class="fm-infix">+</mo><mrow class="ma-repel-adj"><mi class="ma-repel-adj" mathvariant="normal">cos</mi><mrow><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">(</mo><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">x</mi></mrow><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow></span></span></mrow><mo class="fm-infix-loose">=</mo><mrow><mrow><mrow mtagname="msqrt"><mo class="fm-radic">√</mo><span style="vertical-align: 0.086em;"><span class="fm-vert fm-radicand" style="border-top-width: 0.072em;"><mn>2</mn></span></span></mrow><msup><mi class="ma-repel-adj" mathvariant="normal">tan</mi><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: 0.7em;"><mrow><mo class="fm-prefix-tight">−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></span></msup></mrow><mrow><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">(</mo><mrow class="ma-repel-adj"><mi class="ma-repel-adj" mathvariant="normal">tan</mi><mspace style="margin-right: 0.17em; <strong>Solution:</strong>

<div class="text-primary border-bottom p-2 mb-2 d-flex justify-content-between align-items-center">
<strong>Solution:</strong>
</div>
<div style="position: relative;z-index:1">

                                <li id="questionBox44" class="hideThis questLiClass">
                                    <div class="ques-no d-flex align-items-center p-3">
                                        <h6><strong>(44/51)</strong>  JEE Advanced 2023 Paper - 1</h6>
                                        <span>4 / -0</span>

<span class="h5">Let <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><mrow><mn>7</mn><mo>⏞</mo></mrow><msup><mrow><mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn><mo class="fm-postfix-tight">.</mo></mrow><mo class="fm-postfix-tight">.</mo></mrow><mo class="fm-infix">.</mo><mn>57</mn></mrow><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: 0.7em;"><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">r</mi></span></msup></mrow></fmath> denote the <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">(</mo><mrow><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">r</mi><mo class="fm-infix">+</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">)</mo></mrow></fmath> digit number where the first and the last digits are 7 and the remaining <fmath class="fm-inline"><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">r</mi></fmath> digits are 5. Consider the sum <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">S</mi><mo class="fm-infix-loose">=</mo><mrow><mrow><mrow><mrow><mn>77</mn><mo class="fm-infix">+</mo><mn>757</mn></mrow><mo class="fm-infix">+</mo><mn>7557</mn></mrow><mo class="fm-infix">+</mo><mrow><mrow><mo>.</mo><mo class="fm-postfix-tight">.</mo></mrow><mo class="fm-postfix-tight">.</mo></mrow></mrow><mo class="fm-infix">+</mo><mrow><mrow><mn>7</mn><mo>⏞</mo></mrow><msup><mrow><mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn><mo class="fm-postfix-tight">.</mo></mrow><mo class="fm-postfix-tight">.</mo></mrow><mo class="fm-infix">.</mo><mn>57</mn></mrow><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: 0.7em;"><mn>98</mn></span></msup></mrow></mrow></mrow></fmath>.If <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">S</mi><mo class="fm-infix-loose">=</mo><mrow><mspace style="margin-right: 0.28em; padding-right: 0.001em; visibility: hidden;" width=".28em">&zwnj;</mspace><span mtagname="mfrac" style="vertical-align: 0.126em;"><span class="fm-vert fm-frac"><table><tbody><tr><td class="fm-num-frac fm-inline"><mrow><mrow><mn>7</mn><mo>⏞</mo></mrow><msup><mrow><mrow><mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn><mo class="fm-postfix-tight">.</mo></mrow><mo class="fm-postfix-tight">.</mo></mrow><mo class="fm-infix">.</mo><mn>57</mn></mrow><mo class="fm-infix">+</mo><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">m</mi></mrow><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: 0.7em;"><mn>99</mn></span></msup></mrow></td></tr><tr><td class="fm-den-frac fm-inline"><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">n</mi></td></tr></tbody></table></span></span></mrow></mrow></fmath>, where <fmath class="fm-inline"><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">m</mi></fmath> and <fmath class="fm-inline"><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">n</mi></fmath> are natural numbers less than 3000 , then the value of <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">m</mi><mo class="fm-infix">+</mo><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">n</mi></mrow></fmath> is</span>
</div></div>

</div>

</div></div>

vertical-align: 0.081em; display: inline-block; transform: scaleX(0.5);">|</mo><mo>=</mo></mrow><mo class="fm-mo-Luc" style="font-size: 1.3em; vertical-align: 0.081em; display: inline-block; transform: scaleX(0.5);">|</mo><mrow><span mtagname="mover" style="vertical-align: 0.225em;"><span class="fm-vert"><table><tbody><tr><td><mo style="display: block; margin-top: -0.25em; margin-bottom: -0.25em;">→</mo></td></tr><tr><td class="fm-underover-base"><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic" style="display: block; margin-top: -0.25em;">w</mi></td></tr></tbody></table></span></span><mo class="fm-infix">−</mo><span mtagname="mover" style="vertical-align: 0.225em;"><span class="fm-vert"><table><tbody><tr><td><mo style="display: block; margin-top: -0.25em; margin-bottom: -0.25em;">→</mo></td></tr><tr><td class="fm-underover-base"><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic" style="display: block; margin-top: -0.25em;">u</mi></td></tr></tbody></table></span></span></mrow></mrow><mo class="fm-mo-Luc" style="font-size: 1.3em; vertical-align: 0.081em; display: inline-block; transform: scaleX(0.5);">|</mo></mrow></fmath>. Let <fmath class="fm-inline"><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic" style="padding-right: 0.44ex;">V</mi></fmath> be the volume of the parallelepiped determined by vectors <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><span mtagname="mover" style="vertical-align: 0.225em;"><span class="fm-vert"><table><tbody><tr><td><mo style="display: block; margin-top: -0.25em; margin-bottom: -0.25em;">→</mo></td></tr><tr><td class="fm-underover-base"><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic" style="display: block; margin-top: -0.25em;">u</mi></td></tr></tbody></table></span></span><mo class="fm-separator">,</mo><span mtagname="mover" style="vertical-align: 0.225em;"><span class="fm-vert"><table><tbody><tr><td><mo style="display: block; margin-top: -0.25em; margin-bottom: -0.25em;">→</mo></td></tr><tr><td class="fm-underover-base"><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic" style="display: block; margin-top: -0.25em;">v</mi></td></tr></tbody></table></span></span></mrow></fmath> and <fmath class="fm-inline"><span mtagname="mover" style="vertical-align: 0.225em;"><span class="fm-vert"><table><tbody><tr><td><mo style="display: block; margin-top: -0.25em; margin-bottom: -0.25em;">→</mo></td></tr><tr><td class="fm-underover-base"><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic" style="display: block; margin-top: -0.25em;">w</mi></td></tr></tbody></table></span></span></fmath>. Then the value of <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><mspace style="margin-right: 0.28em; padding-right: 0.001em; visibility: hidden;" width=".28em">&zwnj;</mspace><mrow><span mtagname="mfrac" style="vertical-align: -0.086em;"><span class="fm-vert fm-frac"><table><tbody><tr><td class="fm-num-frac fm-inline"><mn>80</mn></td></tr><tr><td class="fm-den-frac fm-inline"><mrow mtagname="msqrt"><mo class="fm-radic">√</mo><span style="vertical-align: 0.086em;"><span class="fm-vert fm-radicand" style="border-top-width: 0.072em;"><mn>3</mn></span></span></mrow></td></tr></tbody></table></span></span><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic" style="padding-right: 0.44ex;">V</mi></mrow></mrow></fmath> is</span>
</div></div>

mathvariant="italic" style="display: block; margin-top: -0.25em;">w</mi></td></tr></tbody></table></span></span></mrow></mrow></fmath><br><fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><mrow><mrow><mrow><mrow><mrow><mrow><mo class="fm-mo-Luc" style="font-size: 1.508em; vertical-align: 0.118em; display: inline-block; transform: scaleX(0.5);">|</mo><span style="margin-right: 0.28em; padding-right: 0.001em; visibility: hidden;" width=".28em">&zwnj;</mspace><mtext> (Given) </mtext></mrow><mspace style="margin-right: 0.28em; padding-right: 0.001em; visibility: hidden;" width=".28em">&zwnj;</mspace></mrow></mrow></mrow></fmath> <br> In an equilateral triangle, circumcentre, orthrocentre and centroid coincide.<br>Let <fmath class="fm-inline"><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">D</mi></fmath> be the circumcentre of <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><mo class="fm-prefix-tight">△</mo><mrow><mrow><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">A</mi><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">B</mi></mrow><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">C</mi></mrow></mrow></fmath>, then<br><fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><mrow><mrow><mrow><mo>∠</mo><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">A</mi></mrow><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">D</mi></mrow><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">B</mi></mrow><mo class="fm-infix-loose">=</mo><msup><mn>120</mn><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: 0.7em;"><mo>∘</mo></span></msup></mrow></fmath> <br> Given <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><mo class="fm-infix-loose">=</mo><mrow><mspace style="margin-right: 0.28em; padding-right: 0.001em; visibility: hidden;" width=".28em">&zwnj;</mspace><span <span class="h5">Let <fmath class="fm-inline"><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">a</mi></fmath> and <fmath class="fm-inline"><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">b</mi></fmath> be two nonzero real numbers. If the coefficient of <fmath class="fm-inline"><msup><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">x</mi><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: 0.7em;"><mn>5</mn></span></msup></fmath> in the expansion of <fmath class="fm-inline"><msup><mrow><mo class="fm-mo-Luc" style="font-size: 2.05em; vertical-align: -0.128em; display: inline-block; transform: scaleX(0.5);">(</mo><mrow><mrow><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">a</mi><msup><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">x</mi><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: 0.7em;"><mn>2</mn></span></msup></mrow><mo class="fm-infix">+</mo><mrow><mspace style="margin-right: 0.28em; padding-right: 0.001em; visibility: hidden;" width=".28em">&zwnj;</mspace><span mtagname="mfrac" style="vertical-align: 0em;"><span class="fm-vert fm-frac"><table><tbody><tr><td class="fm-num-frac fm-inline"><mn>70</mn></td></tr><tr><td class="fm-den-frac fm-inline"><mrow><mrow><mn>27</mn><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">b</mi></mrow><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">x</mi></mrow></td></tr></tbody></table></span></span></mrow></mrow><mo class="fm-mo-Luc" style="font-size: 2.05em; vertical-align: -0.128em; display: inline-block; transform: scaleX(0.5);">)</mo></mrow><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: 1.23em;"><mn>4</mn></span></msup></fmath> is equal to the coefficient of <fmath class="fm-inline"><msup><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">x</mi><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: 0.7em;"><mrow><mo class="fm-prefix-tight">−</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow></span></msup></fmath> in the expansion of <fmath class="fm-inline"><msup><mrow><mo class="fm-mo-Luc" style="font-size: 2.26em; vertical-align: -0.195em; display: inline-block; transform: scaleX(0.5);">(</mo><mrow><mrow><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">a</mi><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">x</mi></mrow><mo class="fm-infix">−</mo><mrow><mspace style="margin-right: 0.28em; padding-right: 0.001em; visibility: hidden;" width=".28em">&zwnj;</mspace><span mtagname="mfrac" style="vertical-align: -0.126em;"><span class="fm-vert fm-frac"><table><tbody><tr><td class="fm-num-frac fm-inline"><mn>1</mn></td></tr><tr><td class="fm-den-frac fm-inline"><mrow><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">b</mi><msup><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">x</mi><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: 0.7em;"><mn>2</mn></span></msup></mrow></td></tr></tbody></table></span></span></mrow></mrow><mo class="fm-mo-Luc" style="font-size: 2.26em; <span class="h5">Let <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">α</mi><mo class="fm-separator">,</mo><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">β</mi></mrow></fmath> and <fmath class="fm-inline"><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">γ</mi></fmath> be real numbers. solution<br>(R) <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><mrow><mrow><mrow><mspace style="margin-right: 0.28em; padding-right: 0.001em; visibility: hidden;" width=".28em">&zwnj;</mspace><mtext> If <div class="hscrollenable"></div><fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><mrow><mrow><mrow><mspace style="margin-right: 0.28em; padding-right: 0.001em; visibility: hidden;" width=".28em"></mspace><mtext>&nbsp;Mean </mtext></mrow><mspace style="margin-right: 0.28em; </div></div>

For a plane <fmath class="fm-inline"><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic" style="padding-right: 0.44ex;">H</mi></fmath>, let <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic" style="padding-right: 0.44ex;">d</mi><mrow><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">(</mo><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic" style="padding-right: 0.44ex;">H</mi><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">)</mo></mrow></mrow></fmath> denote the smallest possible distance between the points of <fmath class="fm-inline"><msub><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">ℓ</mi><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: -0.5em;"><mn>2</mn></span></msub></fmath> and <fmath class="fm-inline"><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic" style="padding-right: 0.44ex;">H</mi></fmath>. Let <fmath class="fm-inline"><msub><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic" style="padding-right: 0.44ex;">H</mi><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: -0.5em;"><mn>0</mn></span></msub></fmath> be a plane in <fmath class="fm-inline"><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic" style="padding-right: 0.44ex;">X</mi></fmath> for which <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic" style="padding-right: 0.44ex;">d</mi><mrow><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">(</mo><msub><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic" style="padding-right: 0.44ex;">H</mi><span class="fm-script fm-inline" style="vertical-align: -0.5em;"><mn>0</mn></span></msub><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">)</mo></mrow></mrow></fmath> is the maximum value of <fmath class="fm-inline"><mrow><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic" style="padding-right: 0.44ex;">d</mi><mrow><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">(</mo><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic" style="padding-right: 0.44ex;">H</mi><mo class="fm-mo-Luc">)</mo></mrow></mrow></fmath> as <fmath class="fm-inline"><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic" style="padding-right: 0.44ex;">H</mi></fmath> varies over all planes in <fmath class="fm-inline"><mi class="fm-mi-length-1" mathvariant="italic">x</mi></fmath>.<br>Match each entry in List-I to the correct entries in List-II.<div class="hscrollenable"><img src="https://www.topcoaching.in/ckeditor/plugins/imageuploader/uploads/24_03_14_65f2bf46e978b.png" data-filename="1.png" style="width: 100%;"></div>The correct option is</span>
</div></div>
                                    
                                    
                                    <form class="p-3">
                                                                                
                                                                                                                                            <div class="form-group " id="formGroupOption1473824">
                                                    <div class="form-check form-check-inline" id="radio1">
                                                        <input class="form-check-input" type="radio" id="radioOption1473824">
                                                        <label class="form-check-label d-flex align-items-center" for="radioOption1473824">
                                                            <span class="optionIndex">A</span>

                                                                                                                            <h6 class="langdata1"><style>.fm-math,fmath{font-family:STIXGeneral,'DejaVu Serif','DejaVu Sans',Times,OpenSymbol,'Standard Symbols L',serif;line-height:1.2}.fm-math mtext,fmath mtext{line-height:normal}.fm-mo,.ma-sans-serif,fmath mi[mathvariant*=sans-serif],fmath
